review title: Second visit to this wonderful hotel.
review:
La Maison Arabe is an excellent and peaceful hotel in a very good location for exploring the Medina and also further afield; we walked to the Jardin Majorelle and Gueliz in less than thirty minutes.
The hotel rooms and public spaces are beautifully decorated in traditional Moroccan style and everything is very clean and well maintained. 
The hotel's country club is a great facility just outside the city, great place to go in the afternoon heat to enjoy the pool and relax. 
The food is great, the breakfast buffet has a very wide choice and the restaurant in the evening has an excellent menu and very interesting wine list featuring mainly Moroccan wines, which we rate highly.  We also enjoyed the roof top bar for more casual dining. 
Although we find everything about this hotel to be excellent, the most impressive aspect of La Maison Arabe is definitely its staff. They could not be any more helpful or friendly, they are a real asset to the hotel.
This was our second visit to this wonderful hotel, and we will definitely return.

I can‚Äôt say enough about Maison Arabe. I have had the great fortune of traveling and it‚Äôs the most wonderful, magical place I‚Äôve ever stayed. The staff is exemplary!!! The food is amazing. My only disappointment is the pool was closed and we learned having dinner there is highly recommended. I can‚Äôt say enough about the staff! I felt like a princess. In fact, I get choked up thinking about how kind everyone was. A special thanks to Hakim, Redwane, the bar tender and another gentleman who also worked at the front desk. Everyone was special!! I hope to return one day!

We were very pleasantly surprised by La Maison Arabe, when booking we didn't study it much but the service was 5* from the moment we booked. The hotel refunded us for an extra day we accidentally booked which was very kind. They knew I'd recently been in a traffic accident in the UK so they organised a 4x4 car to pick us up from the airport for free. The team were highly professional and warm spirited throughout our stay. They helped us organise trips, taxis and offered daily advice. Our room was immaculate, opulent yet homely and felt luxurious. I've tried to recreate our stay at home by buying orange blossom essence, brass hooks and towel robes :)

The hotel has a jazz piano bar and lots of history too. I think Winston Churchill was a frequent visitor. 

As someone who cannot eat gluten or dairy I often find hotel breakfast difficult. However the food was great! I had almond milk in my coffee and plenty of options for food; omelette, fresh figs, fresh beetroot juice, savoury options, fruit, quinoa and more. 

At the time of visiting the pool was under construction so the hotel had an hourly shuttle which took us to their second private property which has a fabulous luxury outdoor pool set in hectors of gardens and in a beautiful setting. I would have liked to have known about this before arriving, but they certainly redeemed themselves. 

My only criticism was that one of the taxis they booked us during the week didn't have seatbelts, but perhaps they didn't know that when booking. And, that the fallback pool didn't serve alcohol like the hotel did. But the lunch we ordered was delicious. 

The hotel is very well located and we mostly walked everyday to our destinations. On arrival we booked a walking tour which was such a great idea as we saw so much of the local area and the guide over indexed on the arts which is our passion. 

I'd definitely return here again!

review title: An enjoyable stay but somewhat mixed in terms of service.
review:
I spent a week in Marrakech, splitting my stay between a resort on the outskirts of town and a 3-night stay at Four Seasons to explore the city. After an exceptional experience at the first resort, the Four Seasons proved less consistent in service. That said, the hotel does have some great staff amongst the team - particular thanks to Fatima and Hisham. 

Unlike most hotels, at the Four Seasons Marrakech many staff fail to acknowledge guests with a greeting when passing in public spaces, which diminished from the feeling of welcome.

Further details on the stay‚Ä¶ 

> Arrival:
On arrival, only one receptionist was present and already occupied, leading to a short delay. During this time, a welcoming young gent offered Moroccan tea. The formalities of checkin were paired with some unnecessary personal commentary from the receptionist - enquiring on whether I enjoyed solo travel (as she did not) and later remarking on my lack of a tan.

> Room:
I was initially assigned a Garden Patio room, but construction noise prompted a move. This was expertly handled by the front desk supervisor, who arranged an Upper Pavilion room. This room was light-filled, spacious and well-appointed, with generous outdoor seating and peaceful garden views. It is also detached from the main building and felt private. Housekeeping was good, with the notable exception of missing turndown service on the second evening. As for sleep quality, the bed was the usual Four Seasons high quality however the aircon not very effective (even on the lowest setting & after being checked). 

> Hotel & Grounds:
It‚Äôs a lovely resort, and the architecture features some nice Moroccan touches - most notably the grand water feature leading to the main building and the indoor d√©cor. Despite its proximity to the city, the hotel grounds are expansive and very enjoyable to stroll. Aircon in the lobby and reception area was inadequate.  

During my stay the hotel was undergoing maintenance, which had not been disclosed at time of booking or on their website. This included the closure of the adults-only pool, leaving only the rather noisy family pool available. After raising this with management, they offered access to the pool in one of their villas. Service from Hisham, the waiter there, was outstanding - a contrast to the main pool, where on my first day staff were disengaged and guests needed to seek out staff / approach the bar themselves.

> Spa:
The massage was relaxing. It was however one of the smallest treatment rooms I‚Äôve been in with some ill fitting curtain making the room brighter than it should be. 

> Dining:
Breakfast at Quattro was very enjoyable. There was a comprehensive buffet with local and international selections, eggs made to order, and a great selection of fruit juices. Staff were friendly and it was a lovely setting for outdoor dining.

Lunch at Azzera was underwhelming. The vegan cobb salad was beautifully presented, but would have benefited from a sauce. Despite an empty well staffed venue, service was inattentive - no one checked on the meal after it was served, water wasn‚Äôt replenished, and the table wasn‚Äôt cleared for some time after dining.

Early evening drinks at Inara on the first night were forgettable - neither the bartender nor waitress knew what a Daiquiri was. 

Zest Rooftop was a standout however - lovely views, good service, tasty cocktails, a DJ, and an enjoyable Asian-inspired menu.

Finally, a note on vegetarian options: beyond salads and pasta, these were limited across all main menus including room service menu. I also had to repeatedly remind staff of a nut allergy, which most premium hotels note at check-in or after the first interaction when dining.

review title: The best Riad in Morocco - there aren't enough superlatives
review:
After spending one night in Marrakech and another in the Agafay Desert, we locked in for the main event and stayed @riadkheirredine for 4 days and 3 nights. I am prone to superlatives but of the 50+ countries and hundreds of hotels that I‚Äôve stayed in, the people at Riad Kheirridine stand above them all. There's no sense in reading any other review because I'm telling you point blank - the answer is Riad Kheirredine.

We absolutely LOVED Marrakech - from shopping for artisan-crafted goods (not just fake stuff from China) in the Souk to the outstanding food, this is a city (and Riad) that i will recommend to everyone i know. It's enchantment from movies is all accurate; a true jewel of Africa.

All of this would have made it an incredible trip on its own but I fell madly in love with the team @riadkheirredine. Why am I so effusive in my praise? They made Morocco accessible and calm and easy in a place that could feel overwhelming and insurmountable. Are you still a little bit unsure about the trip? Go to Kheirredine. 

First, they have someone who always walks with you in the medina and have three meeting points so you always feel safe and comfortable without knowing more than ‚Äúshukran‚Äù in Arabic. It‚Äôs especially helpful at night; never once did I feel unsafe because I had a friendly buddy to guide us everywhere. 

The Riad gives you a smartphone and you text when you need ANYTHING - they arrange ALL the taxis so you feel safe and get the right price. You know how nice it is to know that you‚Äôre not a mark? You save so much money that way it practically pays for the Riad stay. It takes all the stress and anxiety away. All you do is send a text and you get someone to escort you and give you guidance in perfect English or French and a get-to-know-you conversation that brings enrichment to the experience. I became friends with all of the guys who were our guides. Ayoub is such a great guy and the boys at night - Ismail and Noureddine - were so cool and made us feel safe.

Fadwa is the hostess and front of house who plans everything after learning what you are looking for in the experience. If I owned a Riad I would ask her to name her salary because she is the key for the Riad and for us the most important person in Morocco to make the trip exceptional. Her warmth and hospitality made it feel like we‚Äôve known her for years. She is intelligent and socially adept at understanding what kind of experience you're looking to have.  She stands above all and truly was integral to the trip. Listen - if you want to go to Morocco - you need to know her. She is the best of the best. The entire front office bends over backwards to help. I loved Karim, too - he's the smiling, cool guy who helps the Riad run flawlessly.

Amazing right? But that‚Äôs still not all of it. The Marrakech trip was made by the kindness of the entire team. 

My personal highlight was being invited by one of the staff members (Ahmed - my first friend who bridged the cultural gap) on day ONE to break fast with the staff at Iftar after the sun set. It‚Äôs Ramadan so each evening the team gets together which shows the closeness and family atmosphere of the Riad. Ahmed was the blink to open my eyes to Morocco.

I love cultures and food so I was ecstatic to be welcomed in after such a short time. Think of that - the first day they welcomed me into an intimate gathering that is for them and their beliefs. It made me reflect on how guarded and almost standoffish western culture is in terms of bringing in people who are different than us. Energy spent on exclusion is wasted; energy spent of welcoming those who seek to understand creates lifelong memories and friendship.

The three Iftar experiences are moments that I will cherish; conversations that ranged from Morocco and culture to the USA to their families (King of Kindness Mohamed is kid #13 in his family - 6 brothers and 6 sisters who grew up in the Sahara desert) to the status of cats in Morocco (A cat Kingdom üêà üëë). The ‚ÄúUncle‚Äù of the group is a gentle and kind man named Mehdi. We talked about travel and movies and I‚Äôm so stoked when he‚Äôll get to fulfill his dream trip to Italy in the Fall. When was the last time you were shown pictures in a hot air balloon from someone at a Courtyard Marriott? I am proud to say that I will know Mehdi forever. My dude Rabbi is an aspiring rapper and so cool that I could drop him into Toronto or LA and he'd thrive. You‚Äôll hear his tracks on my IG stories. The coolest cat with the moustache is Saleh and he'll make you the best drinks. The unlimited complimentary fresh-squeezed orange juice was out of this world and Khalid and Aymane would be looking for me to give me more. 

I always say that culture is the sharing of stories. People make a place great and the Moroccans we met @riadkheirredine showed me their culture in the greatest ways. 

If you want to go - and you should, trust me - you'll have the best time at Kherrredine. Move it up your list and find Fadwa. It'll be the trip of a lifetime.

review title: This is the best place you will ever stay!
review:
Best experience of our life! I'm telling you, this was the most wonderful stay we've had in all our travels around the world. 
They ordered our driver to pick us up. He was waiting upon arrival. Drove us to the location near riad where the staff was waiting to take all our luggage to the riad. While you're walking to get to the riad, you think OMG, is this going to be ok? Then you walk in to Riad Kheirredine and all your worries fade away! Drinks upon entering, the staff, especially Fadwa made you feel right at home. She showed us every aspect of the riad, all the stunning rooms, food menu, pools, spa facilities, etc. When I say, stunning, I mean stunning. Everyone greets you by name. Our first evening we had Moroccan menu on rooftop and our waiter treated us like royalty. The food was marvelous! Our room was stunning as well! Our bed was a Euro King, which if you know, you know! Loved it! We had a  twin bed for our teen daughter. So comfy. Dark room so you can sleep peacefully. Birds chirping in the morning. Food can be ordered if you want it to the room. 
The Riad also provides you with a cell phone so when you're out in the Medina or walking around and need anything you text them, they will respond and order you a Tuk Tuk or taxi to get you back to a meeting point and one of the staff will come pick you up!! 
We had 3 massages at the spa and it was the best massage I've had. My husband, daughter and I all agreed it was fantastic! They come to your room, hand you your robes, then you follow the ladies to the spa where you are pampered and rubbed. After, you can sit in the serene spa area where you drink tea, have some cookies and relax as long as you'd like. 
Laundry service is included in your stay which was great for us as we had been traveling for about a month in Spain before we arrived. Clothes were laundered and pressed very quickly and hung in room after our day out. 
The breakfast which was included with our stay was so fresh! Juice, fruits, eggs, bread, etc. 
In case you haven't noticed, we truly loved every single bit of our stay. It's a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech city center and everyone felt like family. 
The owner of this riad knows how to do it right! She's Italian and was there during our stay and you can tell she loves what she's created and the people enjoy working there. Truly a magical experience.

A real pleasure to visit this mythical place of Marrakech.
excellent hospitality and accomodation. Historical palace where oriental magic meets european luxury. I would like to come back to this place

The service is the best on the planet, it is a real PALACE service!
No other Hotel in Europe, USA or Asia exceeds LA MAMOUNIA. And so many kindnesses.

review title: Could have been better in terms of cleanliness in room , storage and food choices.
review:
We have been to five star hotels but this one is not five star . This is my experience and I feel staff is trained in such a way that they know which nationality they should be giving preference to.
Drinks were not that good. The only drink was perfect was their coffee from indore bar.
Welcome drink cups were stained all the way around and horrible sugary water. Apparently they were serving fresh orange juice as welcome drink aswell but to some special guest. As far as food is concerned it was not upto standard beside pasta and pizza.
If you carry on tipping every day then one might get some special favours. Just to make our stay comfortable we have to do that.
I agree with other guest rooms are small and cloth storage is not enough for two people sharing hence we left our cloths in suitcases to say the least for comfort.
Guest relation was helpful and manager at breakfast time provided good service.

We‚Äôve just returned back home from a week at the Sol Oasis and we loved every minute of it. The majority of the reviews for this hotel are amazing and they are spot on. I can‚Äôt believe some of the recent lower rated reviews considering the experience I had here.

The food was incredible in my opinion, there were a lot of Moroccan foods in the buffet at lunch and dinner and I was excited to try all the different types of tagines that I could. Fussy eaters may struggle a little bit but my advice would be to just try as much as possible. If that fails, you can always go up the pizza oven by the bar and get a pizza. That was a great option to have throughout the days, from about 2pm til 10pm I think.

As for the drinks, on the most part they were great. One negative was that the same cocktail with one barman could taste completely different when ordered from the next barman, but we never had any that tasted bad. The cocktail list itself was decent and the bar staff will make you something that isn‚Äôt on the menu if you ask. There were 3 options for beer, Estrella, San Miguel and a local beer - all included in the AI. They are all bottled as they do not have draught beer. Soufiane and Nouredine deserve shout outs on the bar team.

The staff at this hotel are amazing, everyone was so friendly. The entertainment team as a whole are fantastic and they all take time out to get to know you and it‚Äôs genuine. Big shout outs to Khalil, Mohamed and Robio in particular who spoke with us often.

We got a massage in the spa which was good and cheap compared to the UK.

The rooms are slightly on the small side but the interior is great and overall we were very happy with the room.

The hotel is about 35/40 mins from the airport and about 30/35 mins to the medina. The hotel clearly states this and anyone who books the hotel should know this before booking, I don‚Äôt understand why people book this hotel and then complain about the location. The hotel provides a shuttle bus at multiple times during the day and this needs to be booked via the app but is very convenient and great to have. This is provided at check in.

Important to mention a couple of minor feedback points:
Drinks service at lunch and dinner was poor mostly, it‚Äôs fine if you want a soft drink or a glass of wine as they are left out for you to take as you want, but to get a beer at dinner wasn‚Äôt easy and nobody came over to us to offer one except for on one occasion.
Some sort of drinks service around the pool would be a great addition, I‚Äôm more than happy to walk to the bar for a drink but every so often the queues would be quite big so having that option would have been good.

I could go on and on listing the positives of this hotel but in conscious of the length of this review! The bottom line is if we decide to return to Marrakech, there is absolutely no doubt that it would be to the Sol Oasis.

The entertainment staff and bar staff absolutely amazing couldn‚Äôt help you enough happy with all

review title: we really enjoyed our stay it was amazing when we arrived there was fresh water in our rooms and aircon we will come aga

review title: My Honest Review of the Hotel
review:
My Honest Review of the Hotel

We arrived late on Saturday, but the reception staff welcomed us warmly and helped us with everything we needed. The next day, when we asked to change our room, they responded kindly and handled it with a smile.

The food was delicious, and the kitchen team did a great job. We really enjoyed trying new dishes.

The animation team was energetic and professional. They truly knew how to entertain guests and get everyone involved in the activities. Some of the team members who stood out were Jenna, Mo, Hamza, Mido, Zack, and Sam ‚Äî they were all friendly, lively, and great at what they do.

This was my first trip to Morocco, and it was a good experience. If I have the chance, I would love to come back again.

Nice hotel, good food, great staff
Jenna always available and professional
We'll probably come back someday.

Great stay on the ground oasis. Many cultural and sporting activities (especially the pool party), very clean places and very friendly and welcoming staff. Thank you Donia and zak and Khalil and Noha and mido and all the services rendered.

review title: Stunning Moroccan architecture and great Indian hospitality
review: The architecture of the courtyard is stunning. You see a lot of great Moroccan architecture in the old city and the courtyard just brings you back there - but uber luxury style. Really enjoyed the hospitality by Mamdouh and his team, the Rivayat Indian food and the amazing view of the gardens! Made our stay really great. Highly recommend a few days here to rejuvenate ‚ù§Ô∏è

Our stay at The Oberoi was amazing from start to finish the service was exemplary. The staff ensure your every need is met and are professional in every respect . The Manager is also very welcoming ensuring you are happy during your stay and interacting with guests on a regular basis . 
The setting is beautiful the decor and attention to detail embraces the true 
Moroccan aesthetic style . We ate in both restaurants the food choice and standards were both excellent.We would definitely return to the hotel all the staff were so warm and friendly particular mention to Adil who looked after us very well in the restaurant and also organised a birthday surprise for my partner, Zachariah at breakfast time and Mohammed who was skilled in his cocktail mixing . However everyone made us very welcome a huge thank you to all the team !

This hotel has the best square very tranquil, superb architecture.
The staff all very attentive and friendly.
The hotel and grounds very well maintained and kept clean at all times.
We keep returning to the hotel as the experience on each occasion is the same "Excellent"

One of the best hotels we have stayed at -beautiful setting , incredible design , very spacious . Not only that but the friendliness and efficiency of all  the staff  was incredibly good. Our room - Deluxe Villa with pool was one of the best we have stayed in - pool was excellent - big enough for swimming and a beautiful garden setting for relaxing. 

Grounds were beautifully kept and enjoyable for walking around- especially to see the rescue donkeys! Even managed a game of Petangue ! Spa was very spacious with a sizeable indoor pool and the treatments were excellent.

Reception were always freindly and helpful and the WhatsApp messaging system worked well. Concierge desk organised some trips for us which were most enjoyable.

We used all three restaurants and all were excellent .We lunched most days at Azure enjoying beautiful salads .Dinners at Rivayat were  excellent and we enjoyed the " tasting " menu with paired wine flights which were all well chosen .We loved the outdoor setting at Tamint - the views were mesmerising and the food was excellent but just the slightest criticism of the choices available- staying eight days , we had no menu changes although we were able to pre-order some dishes which were specially made. Thoroughly enjoyed the suggested Moroccan wines which were a very high standard.  Staff in all three restaurants were so friendly and efficient and clearly gave the impression that they wanted you to enjoy yourselves.

We will certainly return, wanting to explore the Atlas Mountains and more of Marrakech  and might come at a slightly cooler time of the year as the temperatures did rise up to the mid forties.

review title: The best residence for the year 2025
review: The hotel is upscale in all aspects, the service is excellent, the villa was spacious and I cannot forget to thank Mr. Mamdouh for his good service and cooperation with the customers.

The breakfast buffet was diverse and delicious. The staff were not only helpful (they insisted to take my plate to my table for me while I continued to browse the selection) they informed us of and offered us local specialities including a local nut spread, tea, coffee and local breakfast breads.

We were celebrating my birthday and they upgraded us to a villa with a private pool decorated with rose petals, balloons and gifts. So many gifts!

The set menu at the indian restuarant was a culinary experience with lovely staff and beautiful (and tasty) food offerings.

Additionally we booked a hammam experience at the spa. Again, we were treated like royalty. No detail was left unattended. Thank you very much to the two ladies that attended to us - it was a unique and indulgent experience! And to all the staff - thank you for my generous birthday gift.

Every staff member we felt lucky to work with but a special mention for a few of them: Mamdouh Milad, Mahdi and Insaf were at the top of their game. Thank you so much for making our holiday to Marrakesh absolutely unforgettable!

Extra special mention to Zakaria... he took care of us for the majority of our time at the Oberoi. His humour and intelligence were a delight to accompany our meals and leisurely cocktail hours. Perhaps next time we can challenge you to that card game!

To everyone at the Oberoi - thank you so much for a delightful holiday with you.

review title: A relaxing stay with exceptionally warm service.
review:
I‚Äôve been fortunate to have stayed at many premium hotels, and the Oberoi Marrakech truly stands out among the best for its genuine hospitality. 

Oberoi have created a beautiful, spacious & modern resort with lovely historic touches - the attention to detail in architecture of the main building a highlight. The grounds are sprawling with several enjoyable shaded pathways to explore. Aside from indoor and outdoor pools, there‚Äôs also a spa, a gym and a tennis court.

The service was excellent. From the warm welcome, the orientation of the hotel, and the countless staff who remembered my name after just one interaction. Managers were very hands on, always present and showed genuine warmth. Even the gardener discreetly moved aside when he noticed I was taking a photo of the grand canal - so thoughtful.

The Deluxe Villa with private pool was spacious, beautifully appointed and modern whilst retaining charming Moroccoan features. Housekeeping was excellent, but I did find one habit detracted a little from allowing me to feel more at home: each day, the villa was reset as though for new guests - informational signs placed back into prominent positions, rearranged toiletries, repositioned chairs.

Relaxing at the pool was very enjoyable, with loungers, day beds, and hammocks to choose from. One minor suggestion would be for the staff to check in more frequently - at best only two visits in six hours.

Breakfast offered both buffet and √† la carte options. I‚Äôd highly recommend the shakshouka.  

Lunch at Azur was enjoyable, and I appreciated how allergy-friendly all the menus were throughout the property, as well as many common dietary requirements catered for by default. 

Dinner at Rivayat was exceptional. The tasting menu with wine pairings, the beautiful setting, and the fantastic DJ (Fri night) made for a memorable evening. 

Dinner at the other restaurant, Tamimt, was great - lighter fare but full of flavour. The vegetable tagine and pannacotta were tasty, and the live music (Sat night) and outdoor setting making for a very enjoyable evening.

My massage at the spa was very good. A minor suggestion would be for the kettle to be moved away from the relaxation area - its slow boil distracts from an otherwise serene space after the treatment. 

On a final note, I visited in July and the resort was very quiet. If you‚Äôre after a buzzier atmosphere, you might prefer a livelier season. The resort‚Äôs peaceful location is part of its charm and I found a 4-night stay the perfect duration, followed by a 3-night stay in the centre of Marrakech to take in the main sights and atmosphere of the city.

Incredible stay!! Beyond five star service. We Will return. We originally booked for 3 nights but had to extend by an extra day and book new flight. The service we got was incredible! Rooms the peak of luxury. Definately worth every penny. Sp√©cial shout out to Farida who gave my husband the best massage of his life.

Exceptional hotel 
We were welcomed like kings. Thank you to Karima for her welcome, kindness and kindness. 
Villa with incredible pool, the gardens are beautiful, very well maintained (thanks to the gardeners). 
The architecture of the hotel is outstanding. 
All the staff are of exemplary kindness and professionalism. 
Thanks to Mohamed (tamimt) , Rachid and Zakaria (breakfast)
Thanks also to the hostesses in the restaurants. 
The restaurant is of high quality. 
Ideal place to rest and recharge. 
A big thank you

The stay at The Oberoi, Marrakech was amazing, lived up to and beyond to our expectations. From the moment we entered the property to the moment we checked out, we were treated like family. 

Personal touch that made us feel genuinely welcomed and cared for. They were always attentive, checking in discreetly to ensure that every aspect of our stay was as comfortable as possible.

We visited Marrakech to celebrate my wife's birthday and it had been flawless. Our rooms were decorated, cakes and champagnes gifted. She was very happy. And therefore, a special shout out to the housekeeping team, who went above and beyond  to take care of our needs.

The only -ve point I have is that the price of the drinks - they are overly priced.
 
Our stay was an experience, one that sets the benchmark for luxury and hospitality. We will be returning soon.

review title: A Hidden Oasis in the Heart of Marrakesh ‚Äì A Perfect Yoga Retreat
review:
From the moment we arrived at this stunning riad, we were completely enchanted. Tucked away from the bustling medina, it felt like stepping into a peaceful sanctuary ‚Äì the perfect setting for a yoga retreat. The tranquility, beauty, and warmth of the space instantly put us at ease.

The staff were beyond wonderful ‚Äì warm, attentive, and always going the extra mile to make us feel comfortable and cared for. Every single person we encountered radiated kindness and hospitality. We felt truly looked after throughout our stay.

The food was absolutely incredible ‚Äì fresh, nourishing, and full of flavor. Every meal felt like it was prepared with love, and it was the perfect complement to our wellness-focused retreat.

The riad itself is a dream ‚Äì beautifully designed with authentic Moroccan charm, lush courtyards, and calming spaces that made it easy to unwind. The spa was a real highlight too ‚Äì the treatments were world-class, and the hammam was the ultimate indulgence.

I met some beautiful souls during our stay and left feeling grounded, inspired, and already planning our return. If you‚Äôre looking for a peaceful, rejuvenating experience in Marrakesh with heartfelt hospitality, look no further. I loved every moment and will definitely be coming back.

We had the best stay of our lives at Riad le Clos des Arts. The location is excellent in the medina. You are minutes away from 2 of the best palaces in Marrakech, and walking distance from everything in the medina. 

The riad itself is stunning. Photos do not do it justice. The staff are *incredible*. Valeria, Denise, Issam, Sadik and Zakaria were out of this world. They‚Äôre super helpful with recommendations, getting your bearings and generally making you feel like one of the family.

The rooftop is an oasis of beauty. There‚Äôs the dipping pool to escape the heat, the loungers for the sun. Breakfast in the sun, and dinner by moonlight.

The food at the riad is, without any hyperbole, the best in Marrakech. Fresh home made meals that blow your mind. You simply must take advantage of the hamam on-site too. You won‚Äôt regret it. In short, we‚Äôve never stayed anywhere like this before and we will definitely be back!

If I could give this riad a 7, I would.....but we will have to settle for a gushing 5. 

The riad is a haven of peace and tranquility. The staff are superb and the hospitality, consideration and assistance are astounding. The owner said they treated the staff as family and it shows in everything they do. Guests are made to feel like family too. 

Located in the narrow, winding lanes of the Medina, it offers both seclusion from and access to everything you might want to see in Marrakech. The staff are happy to share their immense knowledge of the city and take time to meet and know their guests. They looked to ensure everything went well from the moment we flew in until we returned to the airport 

We dined at the hotel for three nights of our six nights, two of which felt like private dining. A different menu is published each day and the food was excellent. 

I could name names - pick out the aspects that made our stay an absolute pleasure, but that would be unfair to those behind the scenes whose names we never knew.

They well deserve their presence in the top tier of places to stay in Marrakech.

We were very well received in the Riad Clos des Arts.
Excellent location, delicate staff and very attentive.
Comfortable room and breakfast of fresh produce.
Authentic decoration and small but ideal pool to cool off.
We highly recommend it!

Quiet location in the center of the medina and very friendly and welcoming staff. Great breakfast with fresh produce!
We really felt like family 
Thank you and everyone 
Maria Teresa

review title: An Ideal Marrakech Home Base ‚Äì Full Riad Rental for a Family Celebration
review:
We just returned from a full week at Riad Clos des Arts, renting out the entire riad for our family, and had an excellent experience from start to finish. The staff was incredibly helpful even before we arrived.

Once we got there, the service was truly outstanding. Everyone was kind, attentive, and flexible with our schedule. They made everything feel easy and seamless, which let us focus on enjoying our time together. We especially appreciated the care and attentiveness of Sadek, Zachariah, Yaseen, and Valeria‚Äîeach of them made a real effort to ensure we were comfortable and well looked after throughout the stay.

A highlight of the trip was the surprise 80th birthday celebration we planned for our dad. The team went above and beyond to help us pull it off and make it special. Their support and thoughtfulness really stood out and meant a lot to our whole family.

The riad itself is beautiful‚Äîthoughtfully designed and well maintained. The location couldn‚Äôt be better: tucked just steps away from the Medina, but remarkably quiet and peaceful. After exploring the city each day, the rooftop pool was a perfect place to cool down and relax.

We‚Äôre very grateful to the entire team at Riad Clos des Arts. Their professionalism, hospitality, and attention to detail made this a trip we‚Äôll always remember. We‚Äôd gladly return and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Marrakech.

We had a multi-generational family gathering in Marrakech, and took the entire space at Riad Clos des Arts in Marrakech.  We found the facilities to be beautiful, and the staff attentive and helpful.  Rooms and common spaces were tastefully appointed well-equipped.  In particular, we appreciated the attentiveness of Sadek, Zachariah, Yaseen, and Valeria during our trip. They took the time to learn our names, and made us feel very welcome.  We celebrated an 80th birthday with dinner there, and the staff went above and beyond to make it a beautiful event;  we all enjoyed it so much!  The hotel is located on a quiet street off the medina.

There are not enough words to express how caring the Owner and staff are at this Riad.  The location is perfect and the room amazing, above expectations.  Unfortunately we were both pretty sick upon arrival with what turned out to be Bronchitis.  They arranged for a Dr. to come to the Riad and within hours we were on the way to recovery.  Along the way the Staff could not be more supportive or accommodating.

My wife and I stayed here for four nights to celebrate her 40th birthday - our first trip away without the kids since we became parents. What can I say - the Clos Des Arts is just perfect. From the moment we walked in we were enchanted by the luxurious smell the charming Moroccan decor, and overall relaxed vibe of the place. 

When we arrived we were greeted by  Valeria in the square, and she escorted us to the riad where over mint tea, she gave us such a warm welcome and provided us with such a comprehensive breakdown of what we needed to know, places to go to, places to avoid, which online resources to use (maps.me really is excellent), we felt truly looked after from the get-go. Everyone at the riad are just so genuine, friendly and hospitable - I got to know them all by their first names, it felt like we were being looked after by a family. 

The riad itself is situated very close to Jema El-Fenaa (about a 5 - 7 min walk) but in spite of that, it's so quiet at the Clos Des Arts, you'd never guess you were right in the middle of it all.  

What makes this place so special and stand out from the rest for me, is the personal touch. My wife is vegan, and I could not find anything in the form of a cake that didn't have eggs or butter to get her for her birthday. When I asked Valeria for suggestions, she arranged for the house chef to make a special plant-based cake for my wife, at no extra cost! Also, as a Muslim I wanted to go to the Koutobia mosque to do Friday prayer but was concerned that my lack of Arabic language skills would mean that I was refused entry. Issam kindly gave me his very own prayer mat to take with me, to make sure that I fit right in and would gain access without any trouble at all. 

Our time there flew by so quickly, we wished we'd booked a few more days. If we ever go back to Marrakech without the kids, we're definitely going to stay here again - it's an absolute gem. A huge thank you to Valeria, Abdel, Zakaria, Issam, and Yassine (and everyone else) for making our stay there so special.

review title: An oasis of calm amidst the hustle and bustle of Marrakech Medina
review:
It was a wonderful experience to spend some days and nights in this exquisite Riad, which has been so thoughtfuly and beautifully designed and artistically decorated by its owners and managers, Valerie and Denise. From the careful induction meeting introducing us to the Riad and the Medina, to the delights of the in-house Hamman and the treat of eating breakfast and the occasional three course evening meal on the roof terrace, everything about our stay was exceptional. 

Located just a short walk from Jemaa el-Fnaa,  Marrakech's central square, theRiad is perfectly situated nearto all the man sights of the medina, and is a wonderful oasis of calm after the heat, hustle and the bustle of the tiny alleyways of the medina and the souk. A wonderful place. Go if you can!

Visited Dar Ayniwen earlier this week and it was superb in every way. 

Starting with our warm welcome from Aziz, who is like all staff committed to make your stay relaxing, attentive to your every need. 

The food is freshly prepared, generous portion size and delicious. 

The setting is idyllic and tranquil, and it‚Äôs feels like a stay in a beautiful family home. 

We headed out to the madness of the medina and soon retreated back to our oasis of calm, and enjoyed a wonderful relaxing massage. 

Our room Bambou was authentically decorated, was spotlessly clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. 

You can do as much or as little as you want here. A 15-min ride to the city or stay put, swim, relax, play boules or table tennis, have a beer by the pool or find a shady spot to read a book. 

We will be back and would not hesitate in recommending the hotel. 

Thank you to everyone who made our stay so perfect.

A magical place. We went to this establishment for the first time. A warm welcome, the lovely staff, the magnificent garden. A quiet establishment, ideal for a couple. The kitchen is perfect, we order our meal in the morning and the chef prepares it for the evening. For us who are golfers, depending on the course count between 20 to 40 minutes. We come to Marrakech every year, I think we will come back next year.

The hotel is located in a large private park filled with trees, cacti and beautiful flowers. We live among birdsong and from time to time we meet turtles‚Ä¶
There are very few rooms. We feel like we're alone in the world.
The swimming pool is heated, very pleasant.
Everyone takes care of us, it‚Äôs absolute relaxation.
Finally, the cuisine is excellent. We enjoy each new dish.
Happiness‚Ä¶

4 perfect nights. Our 6th visit and won‚Äôt be our last. Poured with rain on the first day but turned out to be a blessing. Spent the day in the main room with the fire lit playing cards and dominoes and let the house cast its spell on us as usual. Beautiful room and food, and wonderful staff. Sun came out for us for the rest of the stay, but now I know that the magic is Dar Ayniwen - not just the weather. Thanks again.

The hotel is a lovely green oasis in an area of sandy soil and palm trees north of Marrakesh, with most rooms in small buildings around the grounds.  We were upgraded to a suite (Tiwalin 1) which was very spacious and stylishly furnished.  Breakfast was served by the pool, and it was very good if a little unvarying - the yoghurt was delicious.  Whether the hotel is right for you or not depends on how you you want to spend your time.  It would be perfect for days in the sun by the pool, but we wanted to do sightseeing and this meant hiring taxis each day, which the hotel manager Aziz was very happy to arrange for us.  We had already stayed for 3 nights in a riad and wanted a change to some fresh air and green space.  We hadn't realised on booking that it was quite so far out of town, but it certainly gave us the relaxing outdoor space we were looking for.  We had a delicious dinner of fish/prawns on the second evening.  The problem was that the small number of diners made the atmosphere a bit awkward, and we didn't return on nights 3 and 4.  Overall a it was a luxurious and characterful hotel, with smiling and attentive staff, which we would be happy to recommend.

Still as heavenly as ever, a unique place in Marrakech lulled by birds in a park with lush vegetation‚Ä¶room and gastronomy at the top‚Ä¶
I recommend this place if you are looking for a place where you can immerse yourself after a colorful visit to the medina

I am a little reluctant to write this as I would love to keep this exquisite place to myself‚Ä¶ But equally, Dar Ayniwen thoroughly deserves a glowing review. 

The property is located in the Palmeraie, a palm grove to the east of Marrakech, dotted with boutique hotels and gated private homes. Upon arrival, after a short drive from the airport, I was warmly welcomed by manager Aziz and, fresh mint tea in hand, I was taken on a tour of the hotel‚Äôs beautiful gardens. I say ‚Äòhotel‚Äô - in fact staying at Dar Ayniwen feels more like being an honoured guest in a private home (which it once was.) An upgrade to the beautiful Tiwaline 1 suite awaited me - and what a room! Adorned with antiques and featuring a separate living room, a domed marble bathroom with walk-in shower and a supremely comfortable bed, it was truly a home from home. On the ground floor, at the side of the main house, Tiwaline 1 opens to a shady riad style garden complete with tortoises and a very vocal Siamese cat!

My 2 night stay was intended as a quiet period of relaxation prior to the arrival of a relative in Marrakech for some more energetic leisure pursuits. And it couldn‚Äôt have been more perfect. A comfortable sun lounger was placed in the spot of my choosing on the expansive lawn near the (heated but still refreshing) pool for an afternoon of much needed sun. (26 degrees was an absolute joy after cold, grey late January England!) When I brought a soft drink from the fridge in my room, a glass was delivered with a little table. This is just one example of how the (superb) staff strike just the right balance - attentive but unobtrusive. And as a solo traveller and first time visitor to Morocco, I felt thoroughly looked after.

Meals are taken in a charming, cosy tent with an open fire. (There‚Äôs a terrace for balmier evenings). Breakfast is a tasty combination of fruit, pastries and Moroccan pancakes, brought to your table. Dinner - ordered in advance to ensure the freshest ingredients can be sourced on the day - was honestly the best food I have eaten in a hotel. The beef tagine was utterly sublime. On my first evening I was welcomed into the tent by owner St√©phane. Merci/shukran St√©phane for sharing your family home with your guests!

For a treat I had booked a spa treatment, but Amina, the hotel‚Äôs beautician, was unwell on the day I had booked, so the hotel arranged a transfer for me to and from a local hammam and spa about 10 minutes away, which I found via google. (I hope Amina is much better now.) 

After two blissful nights cocooned in this peaceful paradise, I left Dar Ayniwen feeling relaxed, refreshed and ready to take on whatever Marrakech had to offer! 

Thank you to St√©phane, Aziz, Ismael, Rashid and everyone who works so hard to make Dar Ayniwen such a welcoming place. They have truly nailed 5 star service in a boutique setting. I shall most certainly return!

A magnificent hotel, high-class welcome and service, all in a warm and friendly atmosphere. The owner is very attentive, the staff very discreet and attentive to the smallest details. The rooms are superb, very well equipped, with heating, important in this season! There is a lot of green space, magnificent aviaries and in addition private terraces in front of each accommodation, privatization and calm. All meals are delicious and plentiful.
A special thank you to Rachid and the chef.
Thank you very much to Aziz, for his availability, kindness and professionalism.
We highly recommend this hotel, as a family, as a couple or alone.
We will come back, for sure!!

We have just spent 4 nights in this intimate hotel nestled in a magnificent green setting conducive to rest and serenity.

The suite is very pleasant, tastefully decorated, the service impeccable, thanks to Aziz for this valuable advice and the table in the evening a delight!

High quality hotel expertise.

We will come back, that‚Äôs undeniable.

This hotel is absolutely breathtaking. It exceeded our expectations for a peaceful getaway. The entire hotel is surrounded by gardens that you can explore, a beautiful pool and main house but to be honest for us the highlight was the staff and the chef!!! The food here was incredible!! If you‚Äôre looking for a more private getaway right outside of the city this is the place. There were also drivers available to be arranged at all times to go into the city or anywhere which was perfect for us. Aziz also made sure to give us all the best recommendations!!! Thank you again for such an incredible stay!

review title: convenient 1 km from the square , if you arrive late at night , do not be scared -
review: We arrived in Marrakech around midnight and I have to say that passing through the dirty, smoky alleys with strange people, the first approach was not the best. The riad is not exactly luxury and the area not really Dubai Marina:-) .BUT, never be fooled by the first impression. the next day with the sun and clean alleys looked better and with time we enjoyed the place than the people. The Moroccans, I must say, are very hospitable and not intrusive, I really liked them, and they are not the ones who come here to criminalize, it is good that you can not consume alcohol, otherwise there would be 200 accidents an hour seen how they run with mopeds through the alleys. That said, the riad has a good service, great breakfast the rooms are appreciable, not really new and perfect, but you always have to consider the cost and where we are. Would I go back? Yeah, maybe I'd try alternatives.

The place allows you to fully grasp the spirit of Marrakech. Ahmed and Achraf are hosts of rare kindness and helpfulness. The structure is charming and quiet. Good quality breakfast. I suggest trying the Hammam experience

review title: An oasis of calm away from the bustling streets of Marrakech's Medina
review:
From Ahamed first meeting our Taxi on the street, to his welcoming Mint Tea, to his farewell, we felt well looked after by him and the team at Riad Ben Tachfine.
Easy to get to by taxi or bus followed by a short walk the Riad is set within a warren of alleys just off a bustling market street in the Medina.
It maybe clich√© however it was truly an oasis of calm away from the bustling streets. Set on 3 levels it comprises 6 rooms and all appeared to be decorated in the local fashion with local furniture. Ours was spacious enough and there were plenty of other areas, within the riad, that could be utilised to sit and read or chat. The one we utilised the most was the roof terrace and ‚Äòcrows nest‚Äô above.
The breakfast was predominately bread based, in a variety of forms along with an omelette and juice, which we devoured each morning. An evening menu was available however would need to be ordered in advance.
We decided to book the ‚Äòin house‚Äô Hammam and again were not disappointed with the experience
The staff were available 24 / 7 and we were always met with a smile no matter the time, or the request. Nothing was too much trouble, from the advice offered to the service received and we felt well looked after during our stay.
We would highly recommend Riad Ben Tachfine. A great location offering a quiet and relaxing place to stay after experiencing the hectic streets of Marrakech, with a welcoming and informative host!

review title: A lovely stay and great location
review: A great location. Walls are very thin so you hear everything and especially when people sit up in the riad or it‚Äôs windy and the roof covering is being blown over. If you‚Äôre a light sleeper you could find this hard. The host was wonderful and very caring and gave us great advice and tips and took time to go through everything with us. Room was clean, though the hairdryer provided blew the electricity and we didn‚Äôt get it back for a while! Plenty of hot water and the breakfast is a good start to the day, but a bit of fruit would be nice with it. It‚Äôs a very useful stay when you want to be close to everything and we felt very safe walking around the area at any time of day or night.

We spent a weekend with friends.
It was an enchanted parenthesis. We were made so welcome. Everything was perfect. Massages, meals, breakfast, decoration...
Our hosts took great care of us.
We had a heavy heart to leave... but we will come back, for sure...

The Riad is beautiful and well
appointed. Our room was clean and comfortable and it was lovely to take breakfast each morning on the open air terrace. We also enjoyed a delicious traditional meal on our first night. The staff - Muhammad, Mehmet and Asharaf and the rest of the team were exceptional and simply couldn't do enough for us - providing safety advice and tourist guidance as well as organising transfer to and from the airport. They are a great example of the graciousness and welcoming nature of the Moroccan people.

The Riad is deep in the alleyways
behind the souks and it can be daunting coming back at night in the dark. But the staff are in hand to provide advice and conducted us from our transfer taxi in our first night. We personally did not experience any problems on our way to and from the Riad at any time.

Riad located in the food souk area in the "upper part" of the medina (15 minutes from Jemaa El Fna square) in a strategic position to visit Marrakech but at the same time far from the chaos and noise of the city;
The staff is superb, Ashraf's welcome and his availability in advising us where to go and giving us all the necessary recommendations every time we ventured to Marrakech was like that of a "family man" and made us feel right from the start. first minute as if we were at home within a family.
The riad is clean and well organised, the rooms are welcoming and have everything you need to have a pleasant stay; The kitchen offers typical Moroccan dishes and I must say after trying it a couple of evenings that it proved to be very good with the quality of the fresh and excellent quality raw materials.
Hygiene and cleanliness are higher than Moroccan standards.
Excellent value for money.
Thanks to Ashraf and the other collaborators for "hosting" us and making our trip to Morocco an even more beautiful experience.

review title: Horrible/terrible location but the riad itself is 10/10
review: Okay so imma break into 2 the riad is 10/10 lovely ppl that work there very accommodating, excellent customer service. The riad itself is nice but it‚Äôs old so my shower and sink kept clogging. Stunning rooms and amazing breakfast however the location is terrible it‚Äôs behind the market and it‚Äôs an alleyway so at nighttime if you are just female travellers it‚Äôs very scary and the men kept starting and cat calling us at times. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable at this location. We stayed in some nights because we didn‚Äôt want to walk through the alleyways at 2am 3am or 4am in the morning. The only way to get to this riad is through the alleyways the taxi can only drop you on the main road than you have walk 3-5 minutes down the market and alleyways to get to the riad, not to mention market smells so bad, they sell anything from fish/meat/clothes so you end up taking all that back to the riad. I didn‚Äôt feel like I was on holiday so we moved places after 2 nights. The riad itself is good vibes I loved it there but I don‚Äôt want to feel like a prisoner on holiday due to the location so we dipped. Didn‚Äôt get refund or even 30% back even though we stayed 2 night out of 7 nights. I was not happy with that at all.

Not recommended!
We booked because the comments were good. I cannot understand it. We arrived in the night at 22.00.
Tha taxi driver asked them to come some meters to pick us up, but they didn t do it. No light on the street, we found finally the riad, the location is in a very poor primitive area, very dirty, lot a sick cats (with crying small baby s), not a pleasant experience to walk to the place. At night it‚Äôs very unsafe with beggars on the street. 
Inside, not clean (as my husband want to take a shower, the drainage was not working, a lot of hair floated on the water).
At breakfast on the day, were 2 tables, one was sitting the ownerfamily and at the second one a gast. The another gast was standig up to give us the table. My chair was broken, as the owner saw it, he gived me his chair, and told me, that he makes allways good things üòÇ.
So.., ( even if we already paid  for the 6 nights) we took the luggages and changed the riad. 
So, this was our experience...

Myself and my family stayed here and had a lovely nights stay. We were welcomed by Ibrihim who helped us with our bags. Malika cooked us an amazing dinner and we also had a lovely breakfast. Great service

We just got back and it was an amazing experience. I have never felt safer in a hotel. The hotel deserves its 5stars rating, it is beautifully done, luxurious and extremely clean. Our room was stunning, the pool always had loungers available, food was brilliant and staff were very friendly. The easiest 5star review ever!
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review:
This was my second visit to the Be Live Collection Adults Only Resort, and it somehow managed to surpass my already high expectations from the first time. I had an incredible trip with my friends, and much of that was thanks to the exceptional staff who made our stay truly memorable.

A special thank you goes to Manager Mouhia and Kaoutar from Public Relations. Their warm, helpful approach made a real difference. Kaoutar, in particular, went above and beyond‚Äîwhen we had trouble reaching our external transfer company, she took it upon herself to track them down and ensure everything was sorted. Her dedication and professionalism were outstanding.

The indoor bar staff were also fantastic, especially the evening shift manager, who made every evening feel special. I‚Äôd also like to give a heartfelt shoutout to Momo from the pool team, who consistently went the extra mile to make our swimming experience enjoyable and relaxing.

Overall, the service at Be Live was exceptional across the board. I‚Äôve stayed at other five-star resorts in places like Dubai, Turkey, and Qatar, but none have matched the level of care and hospitality I experienced here. We‚Äôre already planning our next visit!
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review:
The experience here was amazing, truly brilliant and worth a visit to stay. Madame Mounia, the Quality Manager is an outstanding manager. She is so welcoming, approachable, lovely and caring. She treated us like family and not just guest. She was always smilimg, asking us if we were ok and if we need help. That is something you want when you go on holiday, to feel welcomed and loved.

She has an amazing team who are really friendly and always serve with a smile.kaoutar and ghizlane ard the best.
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review: The daytime entertainment was absolutely fantastic! There were so many fun activities around the pool like water polo, ping-pong, and darts , we were never bored. A huge thank you to Mo for his incredible energy and talent. He made every moment so enjoyable and truly turned our holiday into an unforgettable experience.
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review: This hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were very friendly and went out of their way to help you. We stopped in the swim up room which was a godsend in the 40+ degree temperatures. We had an iron and board, tv with a couple of English channels on, tea and coffee making facilities, bathrobes and slippers, free safe and a fridge which was stocked daily with little milk cups and a 2lt bottle of water daily. The wifi was excellent (they were having issues with WiFi externally) and the air con was great. We loved the large shower too. We had little ammeties in the bathroom. A couple of minor letdown were the bees around the snackbar and the lack of speed getting served  and the food was a little limited also. Having said that it was tasty üòã but if your a picky eater you will struggle with the choice. Thank you for a wonderful holiday to all the staff there üòÄ ps we named the little kitten Tiger üòÄ
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review: Arrived and greeted with Moroccan tea . Porter took our bags . We had a swim up room very spacious and clean beds very comfy . Son had a sole room and it was fabulous for him . Mini fridge in room which was stocked up each day with one large bottle of water . Iron and ironing board in swim up room which. Safe which was free to use . Our air conditioning wasn‚Äôt great whereas as sons was really good . We had a bath and shower but could only use the bath water if we filled it up with the shower head . TV didn‚Äôt have many English channels apart from 2 . 2 pools one quiet with swim up bar , this pool is lovely but does need a little tlc . The guests spoil it sometime as they leave empty glasses all round the pool side and this attracts the bees which are everywhere as it is . The louder pool was actually cleaner looking but I do not put this down to staff but to the guests returning the glasses . Bees are a problem around the snack bar area especially and my husband was stung . I don‚Äôt know if there were epi pens if he had a reaction but I‚Äôm glad we didn‚Äôt need to find out . Restaurant food is plentiful and so much choice I really don‚Äôt understand people saying there isn‚Äôt choice . Staff all pleasant especially zizu in lobby bar and the 2 ladies on the snack bar . We had new bath towels everyday and new dressing gowns too . The pool staff are attentive and if they see you struggling with the umbrellas they help straight away . The entertainment team work hard but we don‚Äôt get involved as our holidays are for relaxing we do enough at home ! One thing is that you can only have 2 drinks at a time so you have to make journeys together if you want to get drinks for all family and there was always a queue . This was my big gripe as I saw some staff giving the holiday makers 4 at a time then refusing the next person . This happened on our last day but one when one guest asked for 4 drinks and as refused then sad they had been there 12 days already and they had never refused before she got her 4 drinks but I only had 2 . This is where it needs to be consistent and fair to all . The gardens are kept immaculate and the garden team work extremely hard and probably don‚Äôt get the credit they deserve . Evening entertainment was ok nothing special but sitting in the lovely lobby bar was very nice . There is a resident hotel cat and another 2 cats on hotel grounds one being a small kitten . I grew very attached to the kitten and I really hope that the hotel staff look after them . I did feed them every day . I would definitely go back . What i would change is have more sport on in sports bar, get more staff to help on the snack bar, try to reduce the amount of bees, allow the guests to have more than 2 drinks per visit to bar or bigger glasses . Introduce sparkling wine, more up to date entertainment on evening and rota every 2 weeks and a better toaster in the main restaurant. Big big shout out to the pasta station the food was incredible. All in all we had a fab 2 weeks holiday . Thank you
place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only

review title: The wonderful team and fantastic holiday
review:

The daytime activities fantastic I like darts, archery, belly dancing, salsa and beer pong 
In Saturday pool party is wonderful

review: 2nd time to the hotel. The animation team really make this hotel 5/5. We will definitely return for a 3rd visit. Jiji, chinwi,pitshu,smily,fairouz are the most beautiful kind people and really make the stay exceptional. We have had the best time as a family

review:
