place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant

review: Beautiful traditional restaurant. Ideal location. Warm welcome worthy of a star. The dishes are delicious and generous. Although it is not local, I think what the best profiteroles I have eaten DE my life!! I recommend

This is a wonderful restaurant. All the staff wee very friendly and accommodating. I had a mishap with my dress as my zip broke and 4 ladies working there rushed to help me. 
The food was absolutely delicious, I had the lamb chops with couscous and vegetables and my friend had chicken tagine with vegetables. There were lots of different dishes to choose from. The dancers/ entertainment were amazing, they got everyone involved. Me and my friend  thoroughly enjoyed our time here. Thank you all at Comptoir Darna!

Wow! What a lovely restaurant. All the staff are super friendly and very accommodating. Everyone speaks very good English and will provide anything you need. The food was amazing - lots of different dishes to choose from. The dancers/ entertainment were amazing, they got everyone involved. Me and my boyfriend really enjoyed our time here. Thank you all at Comptoir Darna!

review title: Dinner, Photographer and service was great
review: I had a wonderful experience at Comptoir Darna. The dinner was absolutely delicious, and the staff was incredibly welcoming. My friends and I had a great experience. A special thanks to the photographer Ahmed for capturing great memories. Thank you for the excellent service and amazing food!
Restaurant with very good atmosphere!!!... I'm sorry to give 4 *to the table service. ... did not give the help we needed!!! Very good show!!!  Excellent bar
We had a great time, the food the atmosphere and especially our waiter Abdel very nice. Thank you.

review title: Was an exceptional experience from start to finish!
review: Comptoir Darna was an exceptional experience from start to finish! The food was absolutely delicious - every dish full of flavour and beautifully presented. The atmosphere was incredible, with a perfect balance of elegance and a lively party vibe. The music, dancing, and energy of the place made the evening unforgettable. On top of that, the hospitality was outstanding - the team made us feel so welcome and well looked after. A must-visit if you‚Äôre in Marrakech!

Bring a torch‚Ä¶

Heard so many great things about Comptoir, however failed to live up to its expectations for us. The restaurant theming is beautiful, with a great atmosphere and live music. However, lights are not popular here. Be prepared to use a torch light to read the menu. Service was great to start then slowed down considerably when the restaurant got busier. For whatever reason the waitress didn‚Äôt seem best pleased when we asked to pay by card. Must prefer cash tips.. The food itself was okay at best. Lamb tacos were nice, along with the weeping tiger steak, but neither was warm. The meatball tagine was very dry also. The caramel fondant for dessert was the highlight. Beautiful. What you pay for a meal here, in my opinion, doesn‚Äôt compare to what you might find in the Medina. One final point, dress code on their website is not enforced.
Had an amazing evening together with my friends. Really nice music and vibes. Special thanks to Ahmed, who makes amazing pictures and is really kind!

The know-how of French restaurants combined with the flavors of Morocco.
The welcome and service are impeccable, the dishes certainly expensive for Marrakech are delicious, and the show proposed pleasant.
Once the meal is over, the atmosphere heats up and everything ends with a wild evening.
We had a great time.

The restaurant was a little out the way for us but the atmosphere is unmatched. 

The band on the stairs as you arrive is utterly fantastic but the talent truly lies with the dancers they were phenomenal! 

Food and service were both fantastic, we thoroughly enjoyed our evening here!
Very good experience, delicious and hearty meals, atmosphere at the top from 21h45. Very nice place, class. To do again without hesitation!!!
Our third visit and another fab evening. We took our friends for their first time and they loved it. Great cocktails and service. Love this place.

review title: Excellent evening at the Darna Counter!
review:
We ate very well, so much so that we had to take some of the takeaway food, which is how hearty and tasty it was! The place is super classy, with a refined and festive atmosphere. The dancers were beautiful and very pleasant, adding a real touch of elegance to the evening.

The presentation of the plates was neat, and our waiter was just great: attentive, smiling and professional. Honestly, 10/10! Only small downside, a slight waiting time to be installed, but nothing very serious. An address I recommend without hesitation!

Very nice place no doubt about it but if you are looking for something authentic and typical Moroccan, this is not the right place. Menu as expensive as the French Riviera, restaurant completely Europeanized like many establishments in Marrakech. 
That said our waiter was friendly. Fairly haughty hostesses probably thinking they hold a crazy power with the mandatory reservation. 
I wouldn't advise my relatives.
Superb food, especially the confit duck. Excellent service and really good desserts too. Well worth a stop if in Marrakesh.
Anwar and the entitled team were incredible.  They could not be more accommodating.  Food was delicious, best cheese board in Marrakesh - from a connoisseur‚Ä¶.

review title: Drinks, food and staff was perfect
review:
It was so perfect 
Enjoyed the food and drinks and the staff so sweet and friendly, specially our vaitor Mouss. 
I will diffently recomand to others

Amazing experience, the food and drinks were excellent. Waiter Mouss was very attentive and friendly. We had a birthday and the staff came and sang Happy Birthday in English and in Moroccan. We would gladly return.

Food, ambiance and service are in one word: top! DE DJ completes it; delicious music in DE background without being overbearing. In short, if you‚Äôre ever in Marrakech, DAN you should definitely go to DE Pointbar.
Amazing place with a beautiful atmosphere, delicious food, and excellent service. I highly recommend this spot. We were served by Mr. Saad, who was exceptionally professional and attentive.
Amazing food, great cocktails,  amazing experience and great service from Mustafa and the rest of the team. Magic as good as Dynamo and beautiful music from a talented singer / musicians.
Absolutely brilliant service. Very quick service, the food was lovely and all the staff were very welcoming. Would recommend highly
Perfect meal with anouar, very very sociable and very nice, I highly recommend we have very good food.

A beautiful experience in the heart DE the ochre city

Altogether a very very good experience! Highly recommended.

Very nice atmosphere with a very friendly team. Our waiter Mouss was especially worth mentioning for looking after us. Thanks to the whole team for making our son feel better üòÄ Food was good and cocktails delicious. We were here early, so not yet busy.
Cozy atmosphere, friendly music, amazing service! The food is good, the plates have a very nice composition it is a faultless!

Great service DE Mustapha!
A very friendly atmosphere for a family meal or any other reason. 
A very warm welcome DE all the staff to the attention DE its customers. 
A meal served very quickly we had an aperitif to share as well as dishes and deserts and the food a was excellent from since to the end. A very family atmosphere with a little magic show DE, and very relaxed music. With all this a good value for money, I highly recommend!
Delicious meals , chicken is cooked with many spices DE will revive your taste buds! Not to mention , a server of remarkable kindness.

This restaurant is family run and the staff makes you feel at home right away!
Tucked in the Medina it has an amazing rooftop and the food is reasonably priced while being fresh and packed with flavour
They only accept cash so be sure to carry with you

The food was delicious. We had dinner here two nights in a row. For this price and then delivering this quality is really top! We also want to put the waiter Kenan in the spotlight, he has completed the evening. Highly recommended to go for an evening meal when you are in Marrakech. Note you have to pay cash, but that was no problem.

We relied on trip notes.
Well rather disappointed, chicken meat tasted very special with a lot of spices, it also lacked almost raw cooking in places, fries with small black deposits on them...

Be careful that cash no cb (and no ATM next door).

Very good food and impeccable service. Everything is delicious and the cocktails very tasty. We will return without problem. You have quesadillas, burritos etc... with or without meat. Very reasonable price compared to what we saw elsewhere

It's sooo gooooddd, 
You guys need to try this place. Their foods are amazing and the ambience of this place is wonderful.

:

The food at Roti D'or was absolutely delicious! I especially loved the [ quesadilla ]. The flavors were so authentic and the portions were generous.

Great value for money and would definitely recommend.

Really enjoyed our supper here - the Mexican / Moroccan fusion worked very well, and the quality of the food was excellent. Also thought that the service was friendly and super-efficient. All-in-all, we had a great experience and would recommend.
Decent food, not great flavours but edible. Cats again around the food. Staff were nice and accommodating, food had a hair but was remade. Nice rooftop vibe.

review title: Great if you don't expect culinary prowess
review:
When you see the opinions, and the staging of their leadership qualities upon entering, you start to expect a lot, at the risk of being disappointed. If the meat in the Tex Mex burger is good, and the sauces or presentation are nice, the fries are really basic, just like the burger bread or salad. There is not much missing from this address to be in my eyes better, up to its note. Even to raise prices a little but have home fries and baker burger breads.
The roof terrace is nice, when to some reviews read against the humor of the waiter, I always find it better than a formatted service, bringing it a +
The Golden Roti is a real culinary nugget. I was particularly impressed by the authentic flavor of the dishes. Great congratulations to Chef Reda for his talent and creativity

review title: Excellent time, tasty Moroccan cuisine! Thanks to our server Abdou
review:
We had a great time in this restaurant with a warm atmosphere. Moroccan cuisine is simply EN delicious, especially couscous, which was perfectly fragrant and hearty. A real treat!

Many thanks to Abdou, our waiter, for his welcome, kindness and professionalism throughout the meal. It has greatly contributed to making this experience even more enjoyable.
Great lunch spot! Good food, nice ambiance and they offer a happy hour that includes a free plate of tapas with a purchase of a cocktail. Emad was a good server! Would recommend!
Place to get away from the sun and enjoy a good coffe,  waiter Abdou was really nice and friendly. Will come back for sure :)

Atmosphere is excellent and the location is wonderful. Rooftop vibe with a pretty 360¬∞ view, so perfect for sunset. Food was lovely (we recommend the chicken pastilla), and service was excellent - Abdou was very lovely and welcoming! Prices are reasonable for the location and we would return!
Very good restaurant to come eat, a very nice and fresh interior patio, they have air conditioning, which is appreciated, Emad served us, everything is fine, and good amounts DE food

review title: Great good, great value, great service

Brahim is the man. Best waiter best drinks.       Mojito is pretty good. Service is good . The tapas and cocktail happy hour deal is great.

review title: Highly recommended place. Food and top service, and especially to Brahim. Waiter majisimo and super helpful.
review:
I came here with my husband and we had a lovely dining experience. 
The food was delicious and the interior beautiful 
Thank you to the server Abdou for being so professional while also telling us a bit about your Berber culture. 
All the best!

We stayed at Bazaar Caf√© in July 2025 and the experience was excellent. The food is very good, with fresh and authentic flavors, ideal for those looking to taste the best of local cuisine. Very pleasant experience, very delicious and tasty food, cold and very good beer. BRAHIM's attention a luxury, recommendable place! Cous cous and tajin TOP!

review title: The best place to eat in Marrakech Medina
review:
I beckoned here for tourism. Eaten divinely, the place quiet and well cared for, great location, very very nice staff (Abdou cute and super friendly)!
I highly recommend :)

great experience in the center of Marrakech, excellent food I think adapted and cooked to perfection and possibility to consume local wine. The staff, especially Abdou, was friendly and helpful. recommended for a Moroccan gastronomic break.
Perfect place for a peaceful evening, quality service, Abu our server was very attentive and responsive. The dishes are hearty, I recommend.
The place is very nice to eat, the food is good and Brahim is very attentive. The patio is very nice

We found this amazing place where we enjoyed delicious Morocco food. The place is gorgeous, the food great and Mustafa gave us such an amazing service. I recommend and will come back! Oh we came with our kids who also loved the food!

Visited for dinner with a table on the roof top terrace in time to see the sunset, which was very special.

Staff very friendly and service excellent.

Small menu but all good choices.  Food was amazing and frozen cocktails good too.

During our visit there was a dj playing good music and also a violinist and some Moroccan dancers.  Our three course meal plus 4 alcoholic drinks and bottle of water came to 176,000 Durham so not the cheapest meal but well worth the money.

Highly recommended and will definitely visit again when next in Morocco.

What a vibe! Great food and really friendly staff! Great entertainment. Book ahead because you don‚Äôt want to miss the sunset. Unfortunately we did because even when trying to book a week in advance it was full! Nevertheless the evening was lovely!

One of the nicest places we've been to in Marrakesch. Beautiful roof terrace, nice restaurant, delicious food and cocktails and very kind and professional service. The prices are European plus, so 15‚Ç¨ for a cocktail, but if you want to treat yourself and enjoy a fancy evening in a nice atmosphere - that's the place to go. Try the veggie couscous - it's amazing!

Unfortunately very overpriced is only hyped by influencers. 
Food nothing special and pretty simple. Waiters very arrogant, guests are watched and laughed at.

review title: Really enjoyed the food, the service and stunning rooftop
review: The service is extremely good and fast and they could put a fair few large hotels to shame.  The food was also very good, but a little on the pricer side.  The sunset from the roof top was spectacular, so reserve early as it is very, very busy.  Depending on whether you want to eat or just take a drink, you have time slots as it is that popular. On the night we went there was live music which was excellent, but we didn't stay too late - it ramps up later into the evening with a DJ, so a good spot for a few cocktails.

Very nice family experience!
Whether the atmosphere, the decor, the view or the food everything was perfect.
If you come to Marrakech, go ahead!

This spot is beautiful, it has such great views and vibes. The food came very quickly with great service and the frozen cocktails were divine !! The food is a great mixture of Moroccan style small plates and familiar favourites ! If we come back to Marrakesh we will definitely be going back !!

A friend recommended dardar for a golden hour sunset spot and it did not disappoint.
Beautiful views across Marrakech and stunning sunset.
The staff were attentive and service was very quick. The food was excellent as was the music choice throughout the evening.
Our table booking for 2.5 hours so we arrived at 7.30 got to see the sunset, had a long relaxing meal and some great drinks.
After food there was a real party atmosphere helped by a couple of birthdays in different groups.
Would certainly come again on our next trip.

What a great rooftop terrace is on restaurant Dardar in the Medina. Take a lunch, dinner or a drink. You never have to sit in the sun, there is enough sun protection. The dishes are fine and the staff is very friendly. Do book in advance for dinner.
All excellent from service to food!!! A rooftop with very good atmosphere!!‚Äôexcellent sunset!!! Near the square.

suggested by our riad this restaurant has a beautiful setting with colorful tiles typical of royal palaces of marrakesh. The show for tourists starts at 8 am. Fast service and friendly staff. Very hearty dishes also have kid menus and for the 9-year-old we managed to have chicken skewers not too spicy. Very tourist restaurant at tourist prices .they also have alcoholic beverages in the menu Moroccan ros√© wine was drinkable. Artists engage guests by asking for tips for the photo.

review title: Beautiful venue for an evening in Marrakech
review:
Great place to dine or drink one of their great and scenic cocktails (one of the few places that serves alcohol in Marrakech). 
We just had dinner and ate very well! The restaurant is cool inside (with air conditioning) and boasts a very nice terrace from which to see the city from above and maybe a nice sunset. The food is very good and after dinner you can attend a dancing show. The bartenders are very nice and the waiters very nice!!

What a disappointment! I couldn‚Äôt wait to test this place, the setting as well as the food seemed to really stick to an interesting dynamic and a search for taste and pleasure for customers. 

Unfortunately, it is quite the opposite. The quantities are ridiculous, but still this could be compensated by an explosive taste, precise seasoning or a fair balance. Except it‚Äôs none of that! Bland, tasteless, flavorless and unbalanced! 
And icing on the cake necessarily the bill! Which hurts extremely considering the experience. 
5‚Ç¨ a bottle of water, for a nice but not crazy setting, a simple service, it gives you an idea! 

I advise against

Dardar came highly recommended per the reviews and didn't disappoint although not quite full marks. Rooftop experience was lovely, it positively served wine and beers which we've found to be uncommon in Marrakech and the food was very tasty. It was a little on the pricey side and our group of 6 were placed on a table in the middle sitting on backless chairs which became uncomfortable after a while. Worth a visit but insist on chairs with backs!

We visited for dinner and drinks as a group of friends on holiday.
Our table on the terrace wasn‚Äôt quite ready so we headed to the bar for a cocktail. Cocktails were of a really good standard! 
We were then shown to our table. Great service.  We had a mixture of starters and mains between the 8 of us, all of which were fantastic.  Belly dancers came out during dinner and performed, with some audience participation. Overall great service, friendly staff, excellent atmosphere and the food to match!

We are provided with menus and we opted for a spritz and a beer (being 18:30), specific that we are Italian, drinks arrive and we are asked if we wanted food, but cordially we say no, having a dinner planned elsewhere; 30 minutes pass and again the waiter comes to urge us to take food, which honestly we do not want, he emphasizes, with an air of conceit and a smile on his face, that the consumption is mandatory; very irritated by the ways we take two tapas, once arrived, my boyfriend wanted to get up and leave, without consuming them, irritated by the behavior of the waiter who treated us like waste that could not afford to eat there and for the failure to communicate this 'obligatory expected consumption' but I urged him to stay; they were about to start the evening with the musician, but just finished the food we wanted to leave, we could not wait. In summary I can say that the waiters make an assessment of customers based on what they wear and treat them differently, the prices are high, exaggeratedly for the place where it is located (terrace with black walls, you can not see anything if they put you in the center) , the food is nothing big, all presentation and scene, common flavor, spritz stretched with water. I honestly advise against it, no plus points. I have to put a star on it, but it deserves zero.

Where to start...  Dinner one evening in June, with two, we think "The Terrace of Spices", it's famous, we should have a good evening...! Hop, I reserve, because the place is stormed so much it is THE PLACE TO BE! 
Arrived at 21:45 (only possible slot for reservation), the restaurant is half empty. Crazy. 
Very nice little live music. Friendly and welcoming staff. 
We are offered the map and LA: surprise!!! we are in Saint Tropez! Exorbitant prices! Well it must be really delicious, typical, authentic, who cares to pay for an amazing rooftop experience with a view (I'm still looking for it), right? 
The dishes are coming. Interest-free dishes. Tourist food! In a well-Europeanized place when we just want to be in Marrakech! Because restaurants like this, I have tons where I live. 
It annoys me that people are laughing! In Marrakech, we want softness, human warmth, we want the typical, we want the authentic, we want to forget that guineaty side that we see everywhere! 
Visitor advice: spend your money elsewhere.

review title: Just excellent. Best in the city
review: Never sure what to expect but this was just excellent in every way. Interesting menu and proof That you get what you pay for and to be fair you do pay quite a bit here. Service and food first class in every respect. The waiter had the measure of us and balanced humour with professionalism. Portions more than adequate. Long wine list (not so everywhere in Morocco of course). Interesting dishes on the extensive menu and caters for veg/gf etc. will be back

review title: Great service, cool ambience and fine food
review: A great location, live music, evening sun, fine food and nice service. We would go back there. Make sure to reserve in advance!

A very nice terrace, but with no great views around. Usually full, there is a need to reserve, has shifts, which implies terms to eat with some hurry to give room to the next.
Friendly and efficient staff, live music but international.
It‚Äôs a very nice place in the middle of the medina, but it‚Äôs more European than truly Moroccan, which doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs not a place to visit.
The food is good but I think the prices are too high and the wine is not even spoken.

We came in for lunch. The staff were friendly- no complaints there. We ordered 3 small starters, a bottle of sparkling water and two ice creams (two scoops each). It came out to $88. The food was good but nothing spectacular. I understand that catering to Western clientele, and paying for a nice (but not spectacular) view. If you don't mind overpaying - it is a good place. But you can get better food for a lot less.

food, excellent service --> recommended!
I ate dinner at the Terrasse des Spices one evening but and I am happy to recommend it! I started with very nice salads and really delicious olives (much better than many!) . John Dory and shrimp puff pastry with a saffron cream sauce was very good, good. I very much appreciated that the restaurant offers the possibility to be escorted, free of charge (tips are welcome) to its accommodation after dinner. Good evening.

review title: A Peaceful Culinary Escape in a Historic Riad
review:
Dining at Restaurant Dar Cherifa was a truly special experience. Set inside a beautifully restored 16th-century riad, the ambiance is serene, elegant, and full of charm. It's the kind of place that makes you slow down and soak in the beauty of Marrakech‚Äôs history and architecture.

The menu offers a refined take on traditional Moroccan dishes. We tried the chicken tagine with preserved lemon and olives, and it was absolutely delicious ‚Äî tender, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The desserts and fresh juices were also a highlight.

The staff were welcoming and professional, striking the perfect balance between attentive and discreet. Whether you're coming for lunch, dinner, or just tea under the lanterns, Dar Cherifa is a hidden gem you shouldn't miss.

Unique atmosphere in this typical Moroccan restaurant inside a Riad.
Attentive and kind service.
Authentic, good and hearty dishes.
The price is certainly higher than what you can find in other restaurants in Marrakech, but the atmosphere, service and quality of what you eat are worth every last Dirham.
Particularly the fact that you eat among the paintings of emerging Moroccan artists and that the same paintings, if you want, you can buy.
The architecture of this building is beautiful, the food was amazing, and staff very attentive. I would highly recommend it.
Had a great time, the cooking lesson was very informative and a lot of fun.  Special thanks to Abderrahim and Kawtar for being so gracious and welcoming!
Delicious food and relaxing environment, so much so that we had dinner twice in this Dar during our stay in Marrakech.

review title: Beautiful gastronomic experience in this beautiful Riad
review:
Beautiful Riad, unusual place in the center of the Medina. We were very well received in the middle of the afternoon, beautiful architecture all in height. 
We were delighted by the quality of the cuisine... the pastilla is top. An incredible dessert, with a perfect balance of spices and sweetness: eggplant crumble. 
I highly recommend

We booked it through our riad on the same day we visited the restaurant. Quiet place to enjoy food in a beautiful building - definitely worth visiting if you're an architecture lover. We were one of the last guests, so we ate peacefully, with delicious food. They have in the menu camel meatballs, which I haven't seen in many other restaurants.
A particularly beautiful, quiet place, with extremely friendly staff, with a very tasty local menu.Harder to find among the narrow streets of the old town, but worth the effort to find it.

review title: beautiful local experience at Dar Cherifa
review:
The welcome was incredibly warm! We were a group of 12 and a small corner had been specially arranged for us, which really made the moment pleasant. The dishes were in line with our expectations, delicious and well presented.

At the end of the meal, we unfortunately dropped a small exhibit on site, but the team showed patience and understanding, a real plus. Only small downside: the waiting time to get our change back was a bit long but we remain honest.

It remains a very nice place, typical, where you eat very well (not everyone liked the dessert but it was atypical a bit sweet). A local address that I recommend to live a beautiful Moroccan experience.
Restaurant located in the Medina in an old renovated riad typical Moroccan cuisine with typical Moroccan dishes fair price excellent quality very kind and helpful staff

review title: Excellent experience in Marrakech of Moroccan cuisine
review: Lovely and elegant location, very welcoming and helpful staff despite being late on booking. We enjoyed exceptional Moroccan cuisine and served with courtesy and kindness.
Wonderful! Excellent service, food, and overall experience. So friendly, caring, and attentive. I highly recommend it!

What a magical setting that mixes history and contemporary with these paintings on display.
The service is impeccable with great kindness and professionalism.
The dishes are well made and with a cuisine that has taste 
Thank you not to miss
Beautiful place. Too bad average service and especially not included in the note (marked nowhere ) as I notified us the waiter without smiling, so savory note to finish for an average meal

A unique experience begins the moment you search for the entrance to the restaurant. Entering through an unassuming door, you step into a true fairytale‚Äînot an artificial, touristy Disneyland, but a genuine gallery of art and architecture. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a romantic dinner. And a brilliant introduction to Moroccan cuisine‚Äîthankfully, the well-curated menu is the best guide. Bravo!

The staff at this hotel are so attentive. All your requests and needs are met immediately. The rooms are large and decorated in authentic traditional Moroccan style. At first getting to your room is like being in a maze with so many courtyards and corridors but you soon find your way. Very private and no outside noise except you can hear the birds singing. The breakfast and afternoon tea are very refreshing. Two restaurants on site if you arrive jet lagged you don‚Äôt have to go out. All in all a wonderful experience and I would stay there again. Highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent location excellent staff turn to customers, especially Mr. Driss at the front desk. 
We had a great stay thanks to all of you

Very good workshop! We cooked 2 types DE sala DE Moroccans (taktouka and courgettes), a fish tagine, and an almond and orange blossom pastilla. Very good menu that shows the techniques to use to cook a Tajine. We learned a lot DE Moroccan cuisine (not just these dishes). DE addition, it is a wonderful human experience: Naila and Dada are incredibly kind. It‚Äôs a perfect course for all levels, then eating the final product in the beautiful dining room is a sublime experience.

We not only had a wonderful experience at your hotel but your city was amazing. The La Maison Arabe property is very lovely. The spa was under renovation but we had a beautiful experience nonetheless. Each room and nook were beautifully decorated all very traditional and welcoming. We loved wandering through on the way to the piano jazz bar. What an absolute treat to have such talented musicians every night !! The bartenders made exceptionally crafted drinks. We enjoyed many nights at the lounge. Also that cinnamon smell radiating when you walk in reception was yummy. The staff‚Ä¶
All the staff that we encounter were absolutely amazing. They went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and they were so very accommodating to our needs. They truly are the reason we would recommend the hotel and come back to stay. We truly feel they were exceptional. 
The cooking class was outstanding! 
The 3 hours flew by. We all agreed that the cooking experience was the best of all our activities that we scheduled for our entire stay. Walking distance from the markets and Bahia Palace as well as the Saadian Tombs

review title: Magical stay in this historic hotel.
review:
Incredible stay at the hotel. The grounds of this historic hotel can‚Äôt be matched. The staff is so incredibly warm, kind, and knowledgeable. They made my stay one I will remember forever. I traveled alone and felt safe and looked after by the hotel team every day. I will always come back here when I am in Marrakech. Beautiful city with beautiful people. 

If you want a magical visit, this hotel is the place to stay‚Ä¶

Chef Rachida and the sales manager explained the recipes well and it was very rewarding.
Thank you for the tea master DE ceremonies with his captivating explanations.

review title: Second visit to this wonderful hotel.
review:
La Maison Arabe is an excellent and peaceful hotel in a very good location for exploring the Medina and also further afield; we walked to the Jardin Majorelle and Gueliz in less than thirty minutes.
The hotel rooms and public spaces are beautifully decorated in traditional Moroccan style and everything is very clean and well maintained. 
The hotel's country club is a great facility just outside the city, great place to go in the afternoon heat to enjoy the pool and relax. 
The food is great, the breakfast buffet has a very wide choice and the restaurant in the evening has an excellent menu and very interesting wine list featuring mainly Moroccan wines, which we rate highly.  We also enjoyed the roof top bar for more casual dining. 
Although we find everything about this hotel to be excellent, the most impressive aspect of La Maison Arabe is definitely its staff. They could not be any more helpful or friendly, they are a real asset to the hotel.
This was our second visit to this wonderful hotel, and we will definitely return.

I can‚Äôt say enough about Maison Arabe. I have had the great fortune of traveling and it‚Äôs the most wonderful, magical place I‚Äôve ever stayed. The staff is exemplary!!! The food is amazing. My only disappointment is the pool was closed and we learned having dinner there is highly recommended. I can‚Äôt say enough about the staff! I felt like a princess. In fact, I get choked up thinking about how kind everyone was. A special thanks to Hakim, Redwane, the bar tender and another gentleman who also worked at the front desk. Everyone was special!! I hope to return one day!

We were very pleasantly surprised by La Maison Arabe, when booking we didn't study it much but the service was 5* from the moment we booked. The hotel refunded us for an extra day we accidentally booked which was very kind. They knew I'd recently been in a traffic accident in the UK so they organised a 4x4 car to pick us up from the airport for free. The team were highly professional and warm spirited throughout our stay. They helped us organise trips, taxis and offered daily advice. Our room was immaculate, opulent yet homely and felt luxurious. I've tried to recreate our stay at home by buying orange blossom essence, brass hooks and towel robes :)

The hotel has a jazz piano bar and lots of history too. I think Winston Churchill was a frequent visitor. 

As someone who cannot eat gluten or dairy I often find hotel breakfast difficult. However the food was great! I had almond milk in my coffee and plenty of options for food; omelette, fresh figs, fresh beetroot juice, savoury options, fruit, quinoa and more. 

At the time of visiting the pool was under construction so the hotel had an hourly shuttle which took us to their second private property which has a fabulous luxury outdoor pool set in hectors of gardens and in a beautiful setting. I would have liked to have known about this before arriving, but they certainly redeemed themselves. 

My only criticism was that one of the taxis they booked us during the week didn't have seatbelts, but perhaps they didn't know that when booking. And, that the fallback pool didn't serve alcohol like the hotel did. But the lunch we ordered was delicious. 

The hotel is very well located and we mostly walked everyday to our destinations. On arrival we booked a walking tour which was such a great idea as we saw so much of the local area and the guide over indexed on the arts which is our passion. 

I'd definitely return here again!

review title: Unforgettable getaway to the Arab House
review: In addition to being a mythical Palace, the welcome was perfect for all the staff with a welcome mocktail and every day a tea time/pastry served at 5pm in the patio and its fountain. Perfect room and bathroom with welcome bottle Cafe/the.
Wonderful stay .. Special thanks to Sanaa from the reservation service and to the kids club‚Äôs stuff ..words cannot describe my satisfaction üíêüíê

The Sofitel is a great hotel. The staff and service was great. The kitchen was excellent.

Ahmed was always very friendly and helpful.

review title: Magnificent Hotel 2 steps DE the Medina
review:
The Sofitel Marrakech is a magnificent hotel 2 steps DE the Medina.
We appreciated the personal and warm welcome of Amine, the Director DE Accommodation, upon arrival.
We were in an imperial suite, perfect for a family DE 4 people, overlooking the pools and the Atlas DE la Terrace. The suite is equipped with a large living room and a bedroom with double bed overlooking the terrace and a bedroom with 2 single beds, but the suite has only one bathroom DE, with bath and shower.
We liked the special attentions EN when we arrived in the room, attentions that were renewed every day during our stay to our delight.
The breakfast is very hearty with lots DE choices, EN savoury and sweet, very nice breakfast to have on the terrace even in 40¬∞ C.
The hotel has 3 outdoor swimming pools, 1 of which is reserved for Diamond and limitless Accor members, and an indoor pool in the SPA, which is free for Diamond and limitless members.
We enjoyed the entire stay of the infinity pool reserved for Accor members, quieter. We thank Ilham, Manager of the Darkum bar, and his team including Hassan and Abdelghani who were during our stay very attentive to our well-being at the pool.
In the evening, it is very nice DE have a drink at the So Lounge bar with DJ.
We would like to thank Ikram, Director of Operations, and all her teams for making us have a great time during our stay.

The orangery is an extraordinary restaurant with a warm and friendly atmosphere and the service at the top I highly recommend and Oumaima was very welcoming and I thank all the team and especially Mrs. Siham
One of the best experiences I've ever had, spectacular breakfast. We were served by Nacer, Chahira, Iwachian and Manar and all parts of the hotel have attentive, friendly and polite staff.

We had the best experience at Sofitel! The facilities and equipment were top-notch, Oumaima was incredibly nice and kind she made us feel genuinely welcomed. Radouan also treated us with such care. We felt so special the entire time. It was a warm and joyful night that we‚Äôll always remember.

Thank you to the whole Sofitel team we truly appreciated everything!

My forever favourite place to have fun with friends, and what makes it always better is the kindness of its staff, shoutouts to Oumaima for her warm hospitality and kind words, as well as my friend Redouan for his kindness, hospitality and friendly attitude.
If you want to have fun, cocktails and nice conversations this is THE PLACE.
Excellent dinner well set. The service exceeded expectations and they were very friendly. We came with DE wheelchair and provided us with food as much as possible. We would recommend.

Overall, the staff at Sofitel are incredible. They go out of their way to get to know you and make sure you are enjoying yourself from the moment you enter the lobby area. The day begins with brunch. Farah, Karim, Khalid, and Mustafa are just a few of the people who greet you with a smile and make sure you have a table and meal as you like it. The experiences at the pools were special, too. The staff is exceptional here and working in the hot sun did not prevent them from keeping us comfortable. Wassif and Abaayous (sp?) will provide you with water, towels, drinks, and snacks. Tip them well as they work hard! The dinner dining experience at the hotel's restaurant is lovely. I enjoyed sitting on the patio and listening to the band, a very talented group having the perfect set of songs while dining. The food is delicious and offers both Moroccan and French menus. The staff Wiaam, Kebir, and Hicham were always friendly and attentive to our needs.  And Hanane made an effort to remember exactly how I like my salad and make sure the chef prepared it my way! 
Other people at the hotel who frequently approached us to have casual conversation are Ilham and Chaimae. Thank you so much! We will be back!

Welcome, meals and perfect service! Hichem and Oumayma (as well as the whole team present) really have a gift for receiving. 
We had a great dinner not to mention the setting!

review title: Very nice fusion cuisine in Marrakech
review:
Discovered by chance, we enjoyed the cuisine offered by this restaurant, fusion of different gastronomic cultures African, Caribbean, Moroccan and more. Served in pretty dishes.
Our 2 teenagers - 14 and 11 - also liked it very much. 
Very nice staff 
A very pleasant terrace on the 3rd floor overlooking the medina, with backdrop the Koutoubia.
Friendly and helpful staff to advise you. Very nice location and food of excellent quality and variety. Unfortunately it is not possible to pay by credit card but we highly recommend it!

A must at every visit to Marrakech!
The view is absolutely beautiful, especially at sunset, it is magical. The dishes are delicious, always well presented and full of flavors. The staff is attentive without being invasive, we feel really welcome. Frankly, it‚Äôs a successful 200%, and besides, the value for money is excellent. Not to be missed!

Lovely spot and great food - highly recommend 
Interesting fusion food to mix things up in Morocco especially loved the desert!

We thought we'd try this restaurant after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were blown away by the amazing food and friendly service.
The restaurant is on the main street Riad Zitoun el Jadid, leading to the main square. We were staying nearby so it was an easy walk. 
My daughter ordered the Maffe Beouf which she said was really tender and lean, there was a peanut sauce underneath and it was served with rice. I had the Yassa Poulet which although I'm not mad about chicken on the bone, was so tender it literally fell apart. The onions were very sweet and absolutely delicious. They don't serve alcohol but my daughter said banana smoothie was one of the best she'd ever had, I had lemon schwepps. We ordered a bottle of water then two coffees and shared an enormous slice of gooey chocolate brownie which was absolute heaven. The atmosphere was chilled with some great music playing in the background and the young serving staff were friendly and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and wish we'd had time to visit again, all the above came to about ¬£42.00 worth every penny.

I found it difficult to book dinner.
Unfortunately no one answers the phone for 2 days, I find it abnormal.

A nice friendly establishment. The staff were attentive, the food was exactly as described and very tasty. The prices were fair.
It‚Äôs a ‚Äúcash only‚Äù restaurant so make sure you have enough.

Great place with good views and the RFISSA BERBERE was excellent 
Friendly staff 
Great place to eat and rest after a long walk by Marrakech
The place and the food was amazing ! We had the pastels-saga, braaibroodjie and yassa poulet. All well served and delicious! If we come back to Marrakech, we will repeat for sure !
Great. Fantastic service and amazing food. The best in Marrakech. Really recommend especially the Kenyan Red Curry..

I went with my partner to dinner, we ordered the camel burger, the rice with chicken curry and the chicken msemen and the three courses were 10, if I had to keep one it would certainly be the rice. 
Generous size, fair price and good treatment and atmosphere, after 8 days in Marrakech we can say that it is the best restaurant we have tried here
We are vegetarian and the food was very tasty. Loved the homemade chips and vegan salads. Warm atmosphere and service excellent.

review title: Gentle music, lovely staff, wonderful food - especially if you need variety in your cuisine!
review:
We spotted this place on our wanders through the souks and were intrigued by the fusion African theme / cuisine. Went back the next day and had a lovely, relaxed lunch and great chat with the staff. 

The drinks (Pinneable and Ginger + Avo smoothie) were wonderful. The 
Pastels-saga and Mafe Boeuf were delicious and we tried the Bissap (hibiscus juice) which was lovely! 

We liked some of their tableware and they told us where to find it and the kind of price range and we managed to acquire a selection to take home!

review title: Delicious food, cosi place and super kind staff!
review:
Delicious food (and generous portions) that changes from moroccan cuisine, 
super nice staff (they made us try their ¬´ bissap ¬ª because we didn‚Äôt know it and where so kind to give us a doggybag with our leftovers),
really beautiful place (we stayed inside because we were cold, but there is also a very nice rooftop),
I would definitely recommend this place !

review title: A little expensive compared to the quantity
review:
Very Good quality but few quantities on plates.
You have to add vegetables and more chicken to the yassi chicken, like Berber Seffa.

We dined twice in this beautiful restaurant. The decor is worthy of a thousand and one nights and the food excellent!
Special mention for Anas, our waiter with little care.
We recommend the superb couscous!
Best restaurant in Marrakech .  We will be back just for this place. Nashville  to morocco  just worth for a great clever meal and perfect service.0

Very nice location, very welcoming staff, excellent dishes suggested by the manager
Super recommended

review title: Beautiful Moroccan cuisine in a traditional setting
review:
We had a great time, we have already come to dinner several times in this restaurant.
Beautiful setting, staff with little care explanations of dishes and superb cuisine, it is a treat.( Moroccan cuisine)
A fairly complete wine list 
You'd think you'd have a high bill, not even.
We even made a New Year's Eve 2 years ago it was a superb moment the whole family enjoyed.
A serious restaurant

A magical setting and a service with little care.
The restaurant‚Äôs menu is short but allows you to find its happiness between traditional local cuisine and French cuisine 
The dishes are well made , the flavors and the cookings at the top. 
Everything is delicious and we let ourselves be taken by the musical atmosphere for a journey at the same time taste , auditory and visual.

A sumptuous and magical place where all the typical Moroccan arts are gathered.... is added to this a very good table that serves you a fair and delicious cuisine.... We made the choice of couscous lamb as a main course...a treat knowing that we are demanding on the subject...beautiful discovery!

Nice courteous staff, nice atmosphere and great value!
Food was also very good. Highly recommended.

Beautiful place. 
We feasted on the dishes served which were exquisitely fine. With delicate attention 
But also and above all our butler and the waiters were very kind, 
I highly recommend this place

review title: Calm and voluptuous, know-how and know-how.
review: In a very nice setting we were able to make an excellent dinner with very kind and attentive service. The couscous was delicious...

An excellent place to discover traditional Moroccan cuisine served by Anas the restaurant manager.
A cuisine prepared with exceptional quality ingredients....
Beautiful decor!
A warm team that takes care of customers with attention and a smile.
We enjoyed couscous lamb, St Pierre, Moroccan salads!
An address of excellence!

High quality catering, "palace" service, typical setting and worthy of a palate of 1001 nights.
To be tested for adoption.
Only regret to have discovered this nugget our last night in Marakech.
The whole family, big and small, Moroccan or Western cuisine, has been won over.
Kitchen to fall on the floor! Professionalism and kindness of service to blush! Decor and room atmosphere to make you travel! In summary 100% successful go there with your eyes closed!!!
We enjoyed the entire restaurant to ourselves one evening in December. Food was delicious and very reasonably priced and the staff were wonderful. We even enjoyed live instrumentation.

review title: Believe the reviews. This is an excellent place to dine.
review: A stunning venue that is a sensory experience for the eyes as well as the tastebuds! Exceptional, timely and friendly service, complemented the delicious food. A good range to suit all tastes and wonderful, free extras that make the experience very good value for money. Well worth the visit!

Beautifully decorated restaurant in the Hivernage area of Marrakesh. Fully tiled walls with Moroccan mosaics.
The food is well presented and service impeccable and prompt. One of the few restaurants with wine on the menu.
It was all very good, the guy who manages the orders was very nice. We ordered a chicken Kabab and a tagine
Amazing food, best spring rolls we have ever had! All the staff were so lovely and friendly. We would recommend to everyone! Great spot
Eaten some amazing falafel and excellent lamb tajine. Lovely staff. Great price 18‚Ç¨ for 2 people.

Passage tasting of Marrakesh. We chose Corner Cafe for lunch break. The most artistic avocado salad I have ever eaten! Very nice place. Very kind manager and excellent kitchen girls. A must for the Medina of Marrakesh
Lunch in Marrakech with family: nice location, small place but very nice. Great local food and very nice manager. Try it!

Small and cozy place with some table in the street. Great reception of the host who has always proved helpful. Moroccan food slightly revisited by the great flavor .. as the environment. Price slightly more than the other places in its fascia..ma highly recommended. Bravo to the manager

5 star from here.
Delicious food cozy atmosphere and 
Good service. Good restaurant for children family. 
It can definitely be recommended.

I had already eaten here in 2018 and as my habit, when the restaurants surprise me, I get my business card. I'm back in Marrakech and I came back here to eat and found it on my business card. The food is very good and presented very well. The staff were very kind.

Lovely casual cafe on a shady alley in the Medina in Marrakech. Small, informal. Very friendly, very welcoming - the service really stood out. The hospitality was warm and authentic. And the food was delicious too! A great place to sit outside and people-watch and take a break and eat good food.

Superb discovery of this small restaurant. We appreciated the quality of the meal and the kindness of the waiter and cooks.... They cooked us a small custom meal üòâ Frankly I recommend this place! Clean, cute, excellent meal.
Thank you for everything!

review title: Oasis of serenity in the alleys of the Medina
review: We stopped by Corner Caf√® by chance and were pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is small and secluded and despite being in the middle of the alleys of the Medina, it is like a small oasis of peace and tranquility. We ate very well, it has typical Moroccan dishes and also other small delicacies (we recommend falafel, a real treat). The owner is exquisitely kind and nice. Highly recommended!

review title: If you come to Morocco come here 100/100 recommended
review:
Super friendly owner very friendly. Super good customer service 
Super-tasty food.

Super recommended 10000

Come here for sure

review title: Wish we found this place sooner!
review:
Such a great place!!!! We went there on the last night of our trip, with only 300 dh left to our names (not exaggerating). The service was absolutely amazing- the servers were sooooooo kind and attentive!!! They made the atmosphere really welcoming. 
We had a delicious starter and two lovely tagines for 250 dh-  then some free tea afterwards. Definitely, definitely recommend. :)

Very good close to the square. Entry by chance and very pleasant surprise. Very good local cuisine and tea offered at the end of the meal.  We have a view of the kitchen which is very clean.  I recommend...

Charming place, delicious cuisine (chicken kebab and the divine Moroccan), the staff is very welcoming and invites us to the heart of its culture. 
I highly recommend it.

Again at Nomad, we are loyal to this restaurant where we are never disappointed.
EN viro DE la scientifique, the staff will do their utmost to ensure that you are not too exposed to the sun. The map is always well realized and the view always beautiful. We love this place which we highly recommend.

review title: Friendly rooftop restaurant with disappointing food
review: Sunset dinner , Polite and friendly staff comfortable seating area on the terrace with partial views over the market square below but mostly roof tops were the only good things about this restaurant. We ate zucchini fritters  and beetroot and goats cheese salad to start which were edible but uninspired and for mains the worst marinated grilled chicken we had in a long time, dry  tough and tasteless. The accompanying roasted carrots were nice as were the French beans . There was no sauce and overall a very boring dish poorly executed. We didn‚Äôt stay for dessert. 82 euro including water and a couple of non alcoholic beers each , there must be a lot better than this in Marrakech.

The worst restaurant experience in Marrakech 
A burger for almost 20 euros with industrial bread and 3 potatoes fighting in a duel , a lentil salad without taste or seasoning and dry bread, not fresh 
FUYEZ!!!!

The place is great for its area in the square , the terrace very well to have a nice time, but when they put the water through your nose and charge you at 4 ‚Ç¨ it starts to anger you, we order dinner for 3, 90 ‚Ç¨, the menu with little variety, we order burger 17 ‚Ç¨, simple without extra ingredients, total disappointment, and chicken with white curries, meaning chicken with cream and green beans, we did not understand, in short do not go, there are better and much cheaper places

review title: Great food - Great location - Great service
review: The rooftop terrace is lovely and music and ambiance are great. Amazing sunset views and nice breeze. Food is ok, nothing special..not worth the price for us but Location and service were excellent so that was worth it. We are vegetarian and both the 2 vegetarians mains weren't available. We ended up ordering the 4 vegetarian appetizers which were good but 3 of them were salads so all kind of the same. A shame as I was looking forward to the cauliflower but it wasn't available. It was very busy so definitely a popular spot,  we just got a bit unlucky with the unavailable dishes.

review title: Cozy rooftop with great food, but could be better
review:
Professional welcome , magical place, clean , dishes dosed with great finesse, we feasted with a fish tagine and a crisp monkfish with a sauce that the taste buds remember! 
Excellent desserts. 
A very pleasant moment

Had the most wonderful meal in the roof terrace. Food was outstanding, great recommendations from the waiting staff, and they were so helpful and attentive. If you want to have a wonderful Moroccan meal in a beautiful location, Nomad is the place to go
We sat on the rooftop, which was packed and was cozy. Friendly service and friendly staff. Food was tasty but there are better options to be found in Marrakech.
Great staff. Fantastic location in the medina. We sat on rooftop which had views of the city and sunset. Food was really good. Well worth the visit

Beautiful place for dinner. 
We had the monkfish (which was amazing. The sauce was to die for! My partner thought it was the best dish of the holiday). 
We also had the curried chicken which was tasty. 
Overall the staff were lovely and we had a great dinner. 
We found the seating to be a little tight however with it being very busy

We stopped in because the sorbet sounded really good. Turns out, it was amazing! It comes with two scoops. We ordered the same two scoops, Berber tea, and raspberry Moroccan rose. While we both loved both flavors, my wife preferred the Berber tea. Meanwhile, I absolutely loved the raspberry Moroccan rose. We are returning tomorrow!

I wouldn‚Äôt come back, as there is a lot of dining in Marrakech at much lower prices. They didn‚Äôt have several of the dishes on the menu, already not too long. On the upside, the food was good and the place is nice.
A nice and beautifully decorated rooftop, modern cuisine, high prices compared to other restaurants of the same "standing"

Nice dinner with friends. 
The kitchen is good. Prices are a bit high especially with the 9% service charge. 
The sunset is beautiful!

Stop for lunch by the way. 
Very nice terrace on the roofs of the medina and from where you can see the mountain. 
Proposal of inventive and beautiful dishes. Particularly good fruit cocktails. And all with a smile.

The restaurant on DE ground floor is beautiful with all DE plants. Because of this the roof terrace is actually a bit disappointing but it is still ok. 
However, the food was quite disappointing. 
Staff was ok.

Why not have lunch in the shade DE the vegetation! Well in this restaurant "Le jardin" it is possible under a lemon or fig tree, the place is beautiful! 
We are not surprised when we know that this establishment belongs to the DADA group (nomadic, spice coffee etc...). The cuisine is tasty and the calm DE the place is interesting. Braised tomato soup, garden grilla DES, couscous, zucchini fritters, fresh cucumber cheese are extraordinary. I recommend this cocoon!
The garden is a green oasis in the city. The food was not bad, but not super either. Our company generally found it too cold and a little under-seasoned.

‚ù§Ô∏è 
Staff with little care, intimate setting very well with family.
The best harness of my life! Grill plate very good.

Very nice setting but tourist factory. Unpleasant young staff, high rates, price of service to add on the final note.
Pretty disappointed, I'm not coming back.

A really cool (literally and figuratively!) place for lunch. Menu was a great blend of traditional Moroccan and European cuisine. Gorgeous mocktails and beautiful decor. It was busy but service friendly and effective.

review title: Very nice and cheap place - GO
review: Very nice rooftop overlooking the market and the other roofs. The staff is super friendly. The food is very good quality and everything is very cheap.

We were a group of 12 who enjoyed lunch downstairs in the garden area.  Staff were friendly and knowledgeable and everyone enjoyed the delicious food.  The setting is calm and peaceful after the buzz of the souk just outside the entrance.  Prices were reasonable and portions adequate.
Our only complaint was the booking process (usually necessary for a downstairs table, although you can walk in for the upper levels which are just as pretty when we ate there last year).  Having to send a bank transfer as deposit was a costly endeavour for us (as we dont have paypal) and we felt other options like giving credit card details should have been adequate like many other cities accept.
However, on the day, it was an enjoyable experience and I would recommend it while in Marrakech.
A cool oasis in the middle of the Medina! We stayed for lunch, varied and delicious food, rabbit at all! average price
We were on the rooftop. Very very hot... disappointed by our meal, composed of patatas bravas (not bad) but the plate of grills was very dry.

review title: Great place for lunch or dinner
review: Very good food and service, great place to have lunch with very fair prices, highly recommended! We went twice, we recommend the octopus

Restaurant very touristic... it took battle to have our table we had booked online, but apparently they do not take into account these reservations...Hospitable staff, especially Maryam who is adorable! 
For the setting, I would say very green, but not at all soothing since we were treated to the work with the jackhammers right next door. And also the music is too loud... At the level of dishes, we really liked the different flavors.
Bad food, really rude staff. Despite the booking they made us wait more than an hour, passing people without reservations. To be in Marrakech is also a very expensive restaurant

Excellent welcome... nice relaxed atmosphere.... cuisine with excellent flavors... tajine and delicious couscous 
And especially a service in kindness and smiles of Hasnaa that allowed us to savor even more this moment

review title: Service to review and fresh juice to improve
review:
We had lunch in the garden for the second time and were disappointed by the service on a part that was a bit long 
Fresh juices are not good and not fresh enough!
You can do better...,
The place remains beautiful and the dishes good and correct in price.
In the end we wanted to pay in euros and a young girl refused 50 euro notes because supposedly damaged... in short elsewhere we did not have this problem!!!!
