Beautiful setting, very good restaurant north of the Medina
The place is closed! But how? We have booked!
A magical corner in Marrakech with delicious dishes, warm treatment and an atmosphere that invites you to stay. To repeat.
ATTENTION! The rest is even if you pay by card
Bad service, menu that lies and sketchy payment. Do Not Go Here.
Unforgettable honeymoon with great food and amazing staff!
review:
We had a fantastic honeymoon here. If you're looking for an all-inclusive right in the middle of a city, this is the place to go. You'll be pampered by all the staff, fun activities are organized, the food is amazing, and the staff are incredibly friendly.

And if you want the best cocktails, make sure to visit Hamza and Abderahmane. Wow, such great guys and their cocktails are truly the best in the resort!

Thank you to everyone at TUI Medina Gardens for an unforgettable week.

review title: Shocking decline in the space of 12 months
review:
We came back to Medina gardens for the second year in a row, having had such an amazing time last year. The 2 experiences couldn‚Äôt have been further apart. 

The air conditioning in the room was all but useless, even after having it on all night the temperate was still 21-22 degrees, with 40 degree plus heat outside it was extremely uncomfortable and difficult to sleep. We spoke to reception, someone came to clean the filter, which was absolutely filthy, but it made no difference. 

We purchased day beds so we could have some shade. On the Sunday, the beds by the main pool were all booked so we booked a bed by the relax pool. When we got to the bed, not only was it completely broken but there were no cushions on it. The bed was broken in the middle so both sides tilted towards the middle, the back section was completely broken off so we had nothing to lean up against. When we spoke to the lifeguard and asked for some cushions, he told us they were in the laundry. 

Upon check out we told the receptionist we didn‚Äôt use the bed on Sunday and asked them to remove it. I then had to wait over 30 mins on our last day for the manager to seek out the lifeguard and ask him. She then came back and told me they could not remove it from my charge as we didn‚Äôt let them know on the day and that it had already been charged to my room. We had booked a bed for the final day, so I asked if that could be refunded, the manager agreed, I paid the bill. 

Twenty minutes later the same manager came out to the pool to our bed and told me we had to pay for the bed! I refused. 

Service in the main restaurant was slow and poor, as was the food. 

We paid for a jacuzzi for our balcony; hardly any of the jets worked, the plastic surround was tatty and dirty, we only used it once. 

The WiFi was shocking. At least 50% of our stay we had none. It kept going in and out which was frustrating when you‚Äôre trying to listen to music or an audiobook by the pool. 

The resort wreaks of cost cutting and is no longer a premium facility. 

The only positive was the service of the guys making cocktails in ‚Äòthe bar‚Äô they were brilliant, so friendly and excellent service. 

Needless to say we will not be returning next year.

Third time here but first time during Summer as usually come for New Year's Eve. Staff are friendly and helpful. They really do want you to enjoy your time. Food is excellent with great selection and very fresh. I did email hotel 3 times over a 4 month period before arriving in order to request room upgrade but never had response. Our room experience has got worse each time we come here.  Another thing to note is we asked for late check out and paid for this but was only given one option till 6pm. When looking on app we saw we could have checked out 2 hours earlier (which fitted with our flight) and it would have been cheaper. We did tell reception and they apologised. Entertainment staff seem to be enjoying themselves but could have done more to involve people during Entertainment nights. We feel this was much better at new year.  There is unfortunately the same age old issue of the reserving sunbeds at crack of dawn which is a pain and have seen this done so much better at other hotels with app reservations etc. The one morning that the sunbed policy was followed through was much better to avoid the sunbed hoggers who leave the towel and disappear back to bed etc.  Overall this is a beautiful hotel with very hard working friendly staff and we will most likely return again in the future.

Just back from our fourth stay here and it just gets better each year. 
Hotel is in a perfect position for exploring the souks and riads and a very short taxi ride to some of Marrakech‚Äôs best spots such as plus61 restaurant or Al Fassia Aguedal. 

We knew that there had been a change of manager this year and with that some staff changes, so wondered if it would have the same family ran feeling, but there were no issues at all. In fact the whole team were incredible. 
From Chef Said and his hard working squad delivering amazing quality hotel food (wait til you see the desserts!) to Aazzedine and Fatima ü•∞ looking after us superbly. They have all been here years now and are an example to all in terms of service, politeness and friendliness. 
I swam every morning and called in to the restaurant for a coffee before going back to the room and the daily greeting from Abdullah is worth coming back here alone. Top top guy. 
Moroccan hospitality takes some beating, and this goes for outside of the hotel environment too, but if this hotel lacks in any 5star refinery then it‚Äôs made up for in spades by the people. 
From the warm welcome by Abir, Chawki and the management team after a late arrival, to the great service by the pool bar squad including Abdulwahid and Reda, topped off by the best bar staff in the city in Ahmed, Mohamed and Omar. 
There have been changes to the nightly entertainment, not something we‚Äôre huge on, but definitely better, and overall lots of little improvements around the whole hotel which are noticeable. There are even a peacock and hen wandering the superbly kept gardens now, which is a strange sight at first but really adds to the character of the place. 
Padel courts, a heated quiet pool for laps and a great gym keeps you in cake credit (you‚Äôll need it), but if you just want to come away to switch off, enjoy some glorious uninterrupted sunshine with only a 15 minute airport transfer then this is the spot. ( RAK airport was great this year too, so it looks like they have addressed the queuing complaints)
There are so many amazing places to visit in the city and using Medina Gardens as a base is perfect. 
Trips to the secret garden, El Fenn, Kabana, Nobu are all within walking distance and Majorelle area with shops and museums is a 5 minute taxi trip.  Just beware of using InDrive as an uber alternative. Some of the drivers are lunatics! Better to pay the local taxis a bit more for a safer, more enjoyable trip. 
Not sure there‚Äôs much more to add and sorry if I‚Äôve missed anyone out but I‚Äôm really struggling to think of anything negative to say. 
I miss lazing in the pool with the city sounds and the call to prayer floating over the garden walls. 
My wife and I will definitely be returning a fifth time.

This hotel is serene relaxing and stress free with immaculate grounds comfortable and clean rooms and beautiful sunshine. The hotel is in a great location to explore Marrakech.
My husband and I have recently returned from our third visit to Medina Gardens and it continues to amaze me how in the middle of a city the beautiful gardens and the hotel are so peaceful and relaxing. Both pools are of a temperature that you can get straight in and swim and are of a size that they do not get overcrowded.
The restaurant serves a variety of different foods and they are not the same every night as there are different themes.  The head chef Said serves up delectable delights every night and would give Gordon Ramsey a run for his money.
All the staff are amazing and cannot do enough for you to make your stay memorable.  The pool bar staff led by Mustafa and assisted by cheeky boy Reda, Bada and Omar are contantly walking around the hotel grounds with drinks for the guests and they also remember your favourite tipple.  The restaurant servers Fatima and Armin are quick to fill your drinks glass and clear your table and are friendly polite and professional and nothing is too much trouble for them. Abdula the restaurant cleaner is constantly on the go keeping the restaurant clean and hygeinic.  The restaurant manager Chawki who is new to the hotel and had only joined the staff 2 days before we arrived goes above and beyond with his excellent hospitality. The reception I only visited to change currency and the staff member Moad was extreamly helpful and engaging.
The Tui rep Zenib is very knowledly if you have any questions about places to visit and she does not just sell trips if they are not  suitable and she is always on site at the time her notice states.  And last but not least the owner of the hotel Hassan who also comes on site most days and speaks to the quests to make sure eveything is going well.  The hotel has 24 hour security and the head guard Hassan keeps everyone safe.
I have travelled to many countries and only once in Thailand returned to the same hotel, but for a short flight, a beautiful hotel and grounds, relaxation, excellent food, amazing staff this for me is a hotel I can visit time and time again. We will be back for a forth visit

review title: Good Stay At TUI BLUE Medina Gardens
review:
My wife & I have just returned from a two week stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens. Flying time was three hours five minutes from Bristol and Transfer time to the hotel was twenty minutes or so. We arrived at 21:30 but the restaurant remained open for our evening meal. During check-in you are fitted with your AI wristband.
 
We booked a jacuzzi room and were shown to room 2004.  The bed was large and comfortable - air conditioning worked well and was not noisy. Sleep quality was good although we heard loud music 01:20 one morning but didn't know the source.  Room servicing by the household staff was excellent!    I requested extra coat hangers via the Tui blue app - you can make maintenance and housekeeping requests via the app.
 
Wi-Fi - this was free and good within the hotel buildings but was patchy in the garden area.

Money exchange - change your GB pounds to Dirams in reception - we got and exchange rate of 11.8 to the pound. Don't take Dirams home - it's a closed currency. There is a charity box at the airport .

Pools - we used the quiet pool or the surrounding garden area during our our stay as the main pool was loud and busy.  Reserving of sunbeds is supposed to be against the rules but everyone did it.   Depth was 1.5M all areas .Get pool towels from the towel hut with your blue card.  Towels can be well used but are okay.

There is no drinks service at the quiet pool - you need to walk to the main pool bar for drinks or coffee. Nearest toilets were behind the Culinarium restaurant.

Food - we booked one evening meal at the Culinarium via the Tui Blue App - It wouldn't let us book again during our second week as it says one booking only via the app. We found the Culinarium okay but didn't worry about visiting again as we thought the main restaurant was much better for variety. We didn't use the Culinarium lunchtime for the same reason.

The Restaurant is the main place we ate all our meals - Breakfast was very good for choice with live cooking stations for eggs / omelettes etc. Staff were quick to serve Tea or coffee and clearing the used plates . Juices and various fruits available.

Evening meals at The Restaurant are themed - International , Moroccan,  Indian and seafood to name a few. No dress code is in operation here. Choices again are wide and varied. Fish was always available usually at the live cooking stations- The tagines were always worth a look as they contained meats , fish or vegetables cooked with preserved lemons.   Staff serving wines and water were prompt to ask you what you wanted to drink - All the wines including red, rose ,white and Prosecco were very drinkable.  Bottled or draught beer was good too. There was live music, violin and Moroccan, here some evenings too which was nice to listen to as you ate your meal.

Bar - the main bar and the Piano bar are nice and air conditioned, ( lovely when outside it was 40 degrees) although the piano person only appeared a couple of times a week we really enjoyed listening to him .  Service was good here as were the gin & tonics. AI Cocktails are available - the Pina coladas were very nice.

Entertainment - some nights a quiz or musical bingo was available at 21:00 before the main show at 21:45 in the fountain bar. These acts were mostly good. Bar service was ok. Shows include Moroccan show, live music or live act with belly dancers with fire!

Tours - we booked the 09:30 half day historical tour costing approx ¬£30 each - this included a guide and coach - we visited the mosque you see and hear from the hotel (not inside) - we were then taken to the rear of our hotel (dropped behind the wall at the back of the Padel court to continue on foot)  We then walked through the arch across the road to enter the souks (no stopping to look at the stalls)  to visit  Medersa Ben Youssef Marrakech, a historic Islamic school located in the heart of Marrakech and the Bahia Palace. We walked 5.1 miles in total in the heat of Marrakech, so would not recommend if you have mobility issues.  The coach returned us at 12:30 approx - value 5/10.

Checkout - our hotel pick-up was 17:35  - we asked for a late checkout and this was granted at no cost.  

 There are tip boxes in in reception to tip the various departments.
 
We enjoyed our stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens and would recommend it as a destination for your stay.

I hope you find my review helpful!

This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. If you're looking for a relaxing stress free holiday this is the hotel for you.
Rooms- Very comfortable beds and all the essentials you need. Cleanliness is excellent.

Gardens/Pools- Perfect. There is something for everyone. Busy main pool but still relaxing. Private and relaxing garden spaces to sunbathe in and a lovely relax pool. The hotel was full capacity and there are no sunbed wars unless you specifically want a certain bed, however that is your choice and there are always plenty of beds available in the beautiful garden areas which I preferred as they had natural shade under the lovely garden trees. 

Restaurant- Could not have asked for more. The main buffet restaurant (the only one we use on our 4nts stay) was faultless. The food was varied and very tasty. Plenty of choice for everyone. What I appreciated the most though after staying in numerous AI hotels is that this one did not have the over busy canteen feel, it is an oasis of relaxation. I can not explain enough how relaxing meal times was at this hotel compared to other AI hotels I have stayed in.

Staff- Amazing!! All of them. I can not name just one, they were all as friendly and helpful as each other and this is the first time I have experienced this in a hotel. They are so helpful and always have a smile on their face despite how busy. They work long hours in high heat and I never heard anyone complain. They are a true credit to this hotel. 

Gardens- Beautiful. The resident cats I loved (as a cat lover) to fellow cat lovers that have stayed here mum cat is doing well and her kittens, saw the staff feed them and they truly do look after the animals there which I appreciated.

Entertainment- The usual AI entertainment which was pretty good. The Moroccan night was a highlight.

Spa- A friend and myself visited and the massage was amazing. The price is very reasonable and the staff were so friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend a visit.

If you stay here you will not be disappointed. Proximity to Marrakesh is perfect. The staff are all amazing and friendly. Not once did I feel the need to tip all the time, it mode no difference to the experience I received and in turn I made sure that I tipped well in the very convenient tip box for all staff in the reception area. This made the whole tipping process so much more easier and relaxing and to be honest all hotels should adopt this practice, as I am sure people tip much better this was if they do not feel harassed to do so. Please if you stay here tip generously at the end of your stay using this method as all the staff here deserve praise.

I stayed here with friends but will definitely be back soon with my husband who will absolutely love this hotel.

A charming and serene spot hidden within the hustle of Marrakech. The garden is beautifully maintained with vibrant colors and traditional decor. A great place to relax and take in the atmosphere. Perfect for photos and a short break from the busy souks.

review title: The best holiday for Peace & Tranquility
review:
Very quick through airport & leaving on the bus within 30 mins, very impressed with this hotel as soon as we walked in, we were led to seats with mint tea offered before being given our room allocation.
The restaurant was left open for us to eat which was lovely after all the travelling 

On our first night we initially had problems with the air conditioning not working, it took 3 phone calls and 2 visits to reception and nothing was sorted. We spent our first full morning trying to sort it out & It took me eventually going to our tui rep who immediately jumped in and offered another room which we accepted, they were amazing both Abir & Zineb very patient with us. It wasn't fun having to repack and move everything but we were so grateful in having air conditioning the rest of the week.
The hotel is absolutely stunning, we loved the gardens and spent most of our time there as it was slightly cooler that the main pool but we used both pools for swimming, no problems getting a sunbed at any time of day. 

Wifi very good - usually get an esim but wasn't needed this time
We ate every day at the restaurant, food was nice and a good variety, our waiter yasine was very efficient and friendly, we really enjoyed getting to know him over the course of the week and nothing was too much trouble for him. 

We dont drink alcohol but soft drinks all from a bottle and quite lukewarm, a pump tap would've been much better for both staff and guests but we did get ice cold still & sparkling water from the machine. 

We did some of the classes with Laura, she is wonderful really put us at ease and was great with the classes. We had no plans to go to the medina square as we were honestly really anxious about it, she really encouraged us to go even just to walk around and gave us lots of tips and we ended up going, she needs a medal for that üòÇ
We also had a lovely massage, absolutely incredible experience.
Overall this place is all about peace and tranquility with still lots going on, I've never been to the same place twice but I will definitely be returning here and recommending to other friends.
Best holiday I've ever had ‚ù§Ô∏è 

Some niggly bits 
The partition wall between the bedroom & shower needs more privacy, for those staying who are not couples it can be a bit awkward having to undress to get in the shower.
Needs more hooks in the room as there was absolutely nowhere to hang any towels or anything.
Mealtimes constantly having to ask for bowls and spoons as they are not on the table
Shower tray needs some antislip on the gloss white tray so slippery

review title: Some like it HOT! Moroccan magic...
review:
Probably best to start with what's great about this characterful place:
- general vibe. Chilled, no pressure to do anything. If you want/need a place to just 'splat' then you got it. Hearing the daily calls to prayer from within the hotel was fascinating and reminded you where you were -  in the heart of a bustling North African city which is right on your doorstep if you want to explore
- mostly extremely pleasant, friendly staff who clearly work very hard and put in the hours to look after both the customers and the hotel itself. The gardens are lovely with real points of interest and the pool is clean and well kept. 
- the food is great, and I like that if you want 'UK' food (which you really shouldn't whilst here) it's lunchtimes only for chips! 
What could be better...:
- Rooms are a bit tired. Hit with the smell of stale cigarette smoke upon entry. And bits just periodically fell off during our stay - the patio lock, the door lock, the shaving mirror landing in my hand. Our shower door didn't work properly and the handle was covered in limescale. The safe deciding it wasn't letting us in. Minor gripes but expected a bit better. Also, unless you're with your true love, there's not much in the way of privacy with the bathroom being quite exposed to the bedroom area. Towels could do with a refresh, as well, they were quite rough and threadbare. 
- The bar service overall was pretty good, if you're not in a hurry. But the inconsistency in what you asked for (unless it was wine or beer), was quite dramatic. Some times mindblowingly strong cocktails and others had us questioning if there was any alcohol in them. And the pool bar staff were almost mute in their interactions - at least with me. To be fair, I think I'd be a bit naffed off if all carbonated drinks had to be served from plastic or glass bottles and not on tap. Come on TUI, this is a busy hotel, you can't expect staff to serve drinks like they're at a kids' party! Same for the restaurant area. The poor servers have tiny little workstations - no wonder there were a few spectacular crash/tinkles.
Overall, however, it's a lovely hotel, with some fun - but not too full on - entertainment, and quiet spots for those that want it. Add on the Lionesses winning whilst we were there which turned the Fountain Bar into an impromptu jamboree venue and would I recommend this place to friends and family? Yes!
